items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item gaming set|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A ceremonial circlet or diadem (A mark of your ascension to Amazon), a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt pouch containing 15gp

entries.name: Restriction: Female Only
entries: Only women can become Amazons, men are exiled or slaughtered once they have fulfilled their purpose.

entries.name: Feature: Amazon Pride
entries: Amazons are well revered warriors. Whether you are loved or feared, you find that people are often willing to be more lenient with prices and services.
Provided you are still welcome with the Amazons, you can expect free lodging and food for you and your companions within Amazon camps, so long as the men don't stay too long.

entries.name: Reason For Leaving
entries: You have been separated from your tribe for some reason. You can roll on the table to determine why, or chose one that best fits your character.

rows: I was sent on a special mission by my queen, one only I could complete.
I was captured and later escaped, I am trying to find my tribe again.
I was shunned and exiled for refusing to kill/leave my mate/son.
The tribe brings back painful memories, I had to leave.
I am searching for artefacts and allies to help my tribe.
I disagreed with the tribe and decided to go my own way.
I am the only surviving member of my tribe, I am searching for other Amazon tribes.
I simply wanted to explore the world.
I speak down to all men as if they are animals.
I only know war and wilderness, social etiquette and commerce are alien to me.
I am constantly looking for a fight to prove myself to strangers.
The sight of people living ordinary lives amuses me for some reason.
I am always ready for battle, I don't have time for bathing or looking nice.
I don't like subterfuge, I will not lie and hate when others lie.
The simplest, most direct method is usually the best.
I like to scare companions with stories from my life with the tribe.
I only value strength, I care not for morals or wisdom. (Evil)
I must follow the customs and laws of my tribe, even if I don't like it. (Lawful)
I must use what strength I have to serve the greater good. (Good)
I refuse to follow orders I disapprove of. (Chaotic)
An honourable enemy can always become a good friend. (Neutral)
Ambition, I will be more than just another woman, I will be legendary. (Any)
I serve my queen, I have no other loyalties.
I will serve Ares to my dying breath.
My honour is my life.
No man shall ever rule me.
My tribe is wrong about men, I shall never shun/execute an innocent man.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
To surrender in battle is the greatest shame I can feel.
I made a terrible mistake in battle that cost many lives-and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
My hatred of my enemies is blinding and unreasoning.
I obey my queen, even when I disagree with the order.
I refuse to follow the laws of the lands beyond my tribe, this constantly gets me in trouble.

entries: You hail from a famous tribe of warrior women known as the Amazons. Amazons pride themselves on their strength and independence. Men are not permitted among their ranks and are only used for breeding.

Some tribes have agreements with neighbouring tribes and settlements in which, once a year the strongest men are chosen to mate with the Amazons. Any girls born from this union are raised as Amazons themselves while the boys are sent back to their fathers.
In more aggressive tribes, men are captured during raids, enslaved and then slaughtered after the deed is done. Any boys resulting from these unions are usually killed or abandoned.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose two from {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Animal Handling}, {@skill insight} and {@skill Survival}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A collar or set of manacles, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt pouch containing 5gp

entries.name: Feature: Hard Knock Life
entries: You are used to living with great difficulty and can survive with next to nothing. You can survive on half the amount of food and water as others.
In addition, when in a settlement larger than a village, you can believably pose as a beggar or pauper to elicit sympathy and get enough food or coppers to live a squalid life at no expense.

entries.name: Thrall Status
entries: You can roll on the table to determine your current status, or chose one that best fits your character.

rows: I am still a thrall in service to a master.
I have escaped my bonds and am now free.
I was rescued from my old masters by someone else.
I was granted my freedom by my old masters.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: As a thrall you are, or were, expected to be submissive and quiet as you carried out your chores and errands without complaint. Some thralls accept this fate while others are more rebelious and openly despise their masters.

rows: I am submissive and often hesitant to complain, make eye contact or speak out of turn.
I call everyone 'sir' or 'lady' without really thinking about it.
I automatically start doing chores like cleaning out of habit.
I am terrified of ropes, chains and whips.
I look out for my friends and allies.
I am rebellious and hate being told what to do.
I want to prove my strength by subjugating my own thralls. (Evil)
People should respect and obey their betters. (Lawful)
Thralldom is a cruel tradition that should not exist. (Good)
No one should have authority over others. (Chaotic)
I just want to leave my past behind and lead my own life. (Neutral)
I want to make something of my life, I will be a somebody. (Any)
I want revenge on those who hold/held me in bondage, at any cost.
Despite everything, I still feel a sense of loyalty to my masters.
I owe everything to those who freed me.
I am my own master now, I owe nothing to anyone.
I feel a kinship with anyone who has suffered as a thrall and wish to help them however I can.
I long to return to my old life and family before I became a thrall, or at least whatever is left of them.
The cruelty of my masters has made me nervous and shy in social situations.
I tend to go along with others unquestioningly, even when I disagree with them.
I value my own life as lesser and more expendable than those around me.
I have a habit of stealing food as I fear I'll go hungry otherwise.
I am overly protective of my belongings and refuse to share, even with close friends.
I distrust people as I fear everyone I meet is secretly trying to make me their own thrall.

entries: You are, or were, a thrall to a particular individual or clan in the Northlands. Thralls are the lowest sapient beings on the social ladder, they are the slaves and serfs of the clan.

Most thralls are basic labourers such as farmers, miners and haulers. A few are put into service as house servants, concubines and cooks. Especially strong and loyal thralls may end up as housecarls, bodyguards and even raiders in their own right.
Sometimes entire hamlets and villages are held as thralls to a nearby clan under threat of raiding. Though particular individuals may also be seized and taken home to serve as personal thralls.

Even under the kindest masters, the life of a thrall is hard. You have, or had, no freedom or possessions and had to make do with whatever food and clothing your masters allow. You are, or were, expected to serve without complaint with your life as the only reward.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: One type of {@item gaming set|phb} or {@item musical instrument|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A helmet or set of bracers bearing the sigil of your clan, a {@item gaming set|phb} or {@item musical instrument|phb} of your choice, a set of {@item common clothes|phb}, and a belt pouch containing 10gp

entries.name: Feature: Hearth and Home
entries: Provided you are still welcome, you can always find free food and lodging of a modest standard for you and your companions when in a settlement owned by your clan. Those who fear your clan's banners may also provide food and lodging if you agree to not burn down their homes.

entries.name: Role In Raider Crew
entries: All raiders are expected to fight but usually also have more specialised roles. You can roll on the table to determine why, or chose one that best fits your character.

rows: Skipper
Helmsman
Shiphand or Oarsman
Navigator
Warrior
Scout or Hunter
Healer or Shaman
Shipbuilder
Skald, horn blower or war drummer
Support staff (cook, blacksmith, or the like)

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Raiders are battle hardened warriors who strike fear into the hearts of their victims, possessing unwavering determination and fury in battle. Many raiders claim to not fear death as a good, honourable death is the ultimate goal of any raider.

rows: Nothing brings me more joy than the heat of battle.
I am extremely loyal to my clan and it's traditions.
I can get very competitive in almost everything I do.
I enjoy battles of wit as much as I enjoy battles of blood.
I am always the loudest and merriest one at a feast.
I like to resolve matters quickly, even if my solutions seem hasty.
I live everyday as if it is my last, because it could well be.
I take great care in my appearance, if I die today I want to look good doing it.
The strong take what they want, the weak suffer what they must. (Evil)
I must obey my jarl, even if I don't like their demands. (Lawful)
We should only take from those who can spare it or don't deserve what they have. (Good)
Only the gods have true authority over my life, jarls and banners mean little to me. (Chaotic)
The prosperity of one's clan is all that matters, however you choose to provide for it. (Neutral)
One day, all the mead halls in the land will be filled with songs of my glory. (Any)
I serve my jarl and my clan, I have no other loyalties.
My loyalty lies with my crewmates, no one else.
Honour is everything to me.
I have someone back home that I hope I can provide for with the treasures I seize.
My clan's jarl is a weak or cruel ruler I will see them punished or usurped if I can.
I still hold a grudge against another raider or clan for what they did to me.
I can't help but take what I want, even when I am not raiding.
I am haunted by memories of something I did or saw during a raid.
I often lose control in the heat of battle.
If someone questions my courage or honour, I will never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
I can get very agressive when I'm drunk, and I'm drunk often.
While I claim not to fear death, I am actually terrified of it.

entries: You are a raider for your clan in The Northlands. You lead a brutal and violent life constantly just an axe swing away from death, but it's worth it. The treasure you bring back to your clan grants you much glory and renown.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Religion}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One exotic language of your choice (agreed with the DM).

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A bottle of black ink, a quill, a small knife, a ring or amulet signifying your membership in the Magi of Hecate, a set of {@item fine clothes|phb}, and a belt pouch containing 10gp.

entries.name: Feature: Magi Membership
entries: If you are still welcome with the Magi, you can rely on certain benefits that membership provides. You can meet up with colleagues in most settlements larger than a village. These colleagues can help you find information, jobs and make connections to potential allies and patrons. You can usually find enough odd jobs to fund a modest lifestyle with the Magi's help.
You may also earn small discounts when procuring services from other magi, such as performing certain spells, buying and crafting magic items or hiring tutors and mercenaries.

You must pay dues of 5 gp per month to the Magi of Hecate. If you miss payments, you must make up back dues to remain in the Magi's good graces. If you miss too many payments, you may be expelled and need to earn your way back in to regain the benefits of membership.

entries.name: Magus Specialism
entries: Some magi have specialist roles and tend towards jobs aligning with their specialisms. You can select your specialism from the table below or roll randomly, you may also come up with your own.

rows: Generalist.
No specialism.
Utilitarian.
Repairing tools and furniture and performing basic tasks for people.
Entertainer.
Performing party tricks, conjuring wine and fireworks.
Alchemist.
Making and identifying potions and poisons.
Archivist.
Collecting, trading and studying magic items and records.
Healer.
Mending wounds, curing diseases and breaking curses.
Enchanter.
Creating magic items, glyphs and wards.
Tutor.
Training mages, from beginners to experts.
Mercenary.
Fighting, supporting expeditions or training magically-enhanced troops.
Zoologist.
Study of magic creatures and extra-planar beings.
Researcher.
Experimenting and studying new spells and magic.
Advisor.
Advisor to political, religious and military leaders, particularly on subjects related to magic.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Generally, most magi have experience with magic and are accomplished spellcasters, though this is not technically a requirement, the study of magic or magic items is usually enough to grant you membership. Despite their official devotion to Hecate, the magi tend to be more academic or vocational than religious.

rows: I always listen deeply and think carefully before speaking.
I am often insulted by the petty requests common people make of magi, they are a waste of my talents.
I find my work or study far more interesting than dealing with people.
I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
I add a magical flair to almost everything I do, even simple activities like eating a meal or opening a book.
I am always trying to talk people into hiring my services, even when they don't need them.
I don't part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
I look down upon those who don't (or can't) use magic.
Generosity. My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
Law. Magic should be used to enforce the laws of both gods and mortals. (Lawful)
Knowledge. Improving personal and public knowledge should always be a goal, no matter who uses it. (Neutral)
Change. Magic is a tool with which anyone can change the world. (Chaotic)
Gain. I joined the magi solely to seek power, influence or wealth, that desire still drives me above all others. (Evil)
Aspiration. I seek to prove myself a worthy magus to the world and to Hecate herself. (Any)
I adore some or all of my colleagues and will do whatever I can to help them.
Protecting, and providing for, my clients or students is my highest priority.
My workshop or study is one place I feel truly safe and comfortable.
Everything I do, I do to impress a specific person.
My life's work is pursuing or protecting the answer to some great mystery.
I have a rival magus, I will do all I can to be better than them.
My curiosity regarding unknown magics can often lead me into danger.
I'm quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
I always expect to be treated like nobility, even where I have no such authority or status.
I frequently overwork myself at the cost of sleeping or eating properly.
I am never wrong, even when I am.
I fear that I am a fraud and can never live up to the praise and expectations placed upon me.

entries: You are, or were, a member of the much exalted Magi of Hecate, a group of acolytes and academics studying magic and magic items as well as providing magical services, for a fee. Many magi may try to distance themselves from their reputation as mages-for-hire or mercenaries but even magi need money.

It is common for groups of magi to covene in and around temples, shrines and academic institutions to exchange services, knowledge and to collaborate in arcane research and work. Magi can be found in such places in most cities and large towns.

deity.name: Chaos
deity.title: The Original Entity
entries: Chaos was the first entity to exist, they are older than the cosmos itself. To worship Chaos is to worship absence and nothingness. Chaos does not grant any boons or rewards for worship.

customProperties.Typical Forms: Aasimar, Currently Incorporeal in the pit of Tartarus
Triton, Water Elemental, Merman, Giant Crab

deity.name: Prometheus
deity.title: Father of Humans
deity.province: Creator of Humans, Dwarves, Elves and Orcs

customProperties.Typical Forms: Elf, Aasimar, Manifestation of viewer's desires

deity.name: Apollo
deity.title: Lord of Music
deity.province: Music, Lyre, Poetry, Archery, The Sun, Prophecies and Oracles

customProperties.Worshipers: Bards, Poets, Oracles, Fortune Tellers, Archers, Temples

deity.name: Athena
deity.title: Lady of Wisdom
deity.province: Wisdom, Martial Strategy, Politics and Elves

customProperties.Worshipers: Warriors, Amazons, Generals, Politicians, Scholars, Elves
Performers, Whore, Hedonists, Innkeepers, Vineyards, Temples
Smiths, Tinkers, Firewielders, Dwarves, Warforged, Temples

deity.name: Hera
deity.title: Lady of Marriage
deity.province: Women, Marriage, Family, Punishing Adulterers and Bigamists

deity.name: Hermes
deity.title: Lord of Messengers
deity.province: Thieves, Messengers, Travellers, Shepherds, Medicine, Psychopomp for Great Heroes

customProperties.Worshipers: Thieves, Messengers, Travellers, Shepherds, Physicians, Temples

deity.name: Zeus
deity.title: Lord of the Sky
deity.province: King of Olympians, The Sky, Lighting, Xenia, Kings

customProperties.Worshipers: Undertakers, Graveyard Keepers, Necromancers, Temples, Cultists, Assassins
Mages, Scholars of Magic, Some Temples

deity.name: Thanatos
deity.title: The Soul Guide
deity.province: Personification of Death, Psychopomp for dead souls

deity.name: Rexus
deity.title: The Dragon King
entries: Rexus is the leader of the Iuris Legion.

deity.name: Sophus
deity.title: The Scholar
deity.province: Knowledge, wisdom, art and divine punishment through magic, curses and madness

deity.name: Idex
deity.title: The Judge
deity.province: Justice and divine punishment through execution, imprisonment and violence

deity.name: Ferrarius
deity.title: The Smith
deity.province: Forging, masonry, engineering, constructs and divine punishment through fire and explosions

deity.name: Pestas
deity.title: The Storm
deity.province: Storms, the fog and divine punishment through extreme weather and natural disasters
entries: Supposedly sent the fog to punish mortals on the orders of Rexus.

deity.name: Vitas
deity.title: The Protector
entries: Saved a small number of mortals from the fog to start anew.

deity.name: Ricola
deity.title: The Alchemist
deity.province: Alchemy, chemistry and divine punishment through disease and poison

deity.name: Scurra
deity.title: The Jester
deity.province: Cunning, espionage, theatre, comedy and divine punishment through ridicule and defamation
entries: While sometimes considered the black sheep of the Legion, some claim it was Scurra who discovered how to ascend to godhood, granting her a place within the Legion.

deity.name: Mutter
deity.title: The Mother
deity.province: The natural world (Debauchery in Caligos Imperium)
entries: The Mother is vast network of ever expanding roots that form the world itself.

deity.name: Vater
deity.title: The Father
deity.province: Life, family and the sky (Tyranny in Caligos Imperium)
entries: Vater was a rogue root of Mutter that grew upwards and outwards to form the braches that make up the sky. From these branches came life.

deity.name: Wasserie
deity.title: The River, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Water and uncertainty (Anarchy in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Geierin
deity.title: The Night, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Night, magic and curses (Dark magic in Caligos Imperium)

customProperties.Typical Forms: The Moon, Giant Spider, Giant Moth

deity.name: Feus
deity.title: The Warm Winds, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Day, warmth and fire (Droughts and arson in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Eiskel
deity.title: The Cold Winds, Aspect of Mutter
deity.province: Cold winds, snow and ice (Apocalypse in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Maulich
deity.title: The Elk, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Prey, plantlife and agriculture (Weakness and sloth in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Olfus
deity.title: The Wolf, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Predators, hunting and strength of the pack (Violence and savagry in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Zornlich
deity.title: The Bull, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Fury, passion, determination and music (Brutality and destruction in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Sepulcrus
deity.title: The Hare, Aspect of Vater
deity.province: Death and the afterlife (Necromancy and infernals in Caligos Imperium)

deity.name: Talitus
deity.title: The Entropic Entity
deity.province: Time, entropy and mortality (Chaos and pure evil in Caligos Imperium)
entries: Talitus does not directly belong to either the Anarchium or the Iuris Legion. They are the god of time, entropy and death. They represent the inevitable end of everything, even the gods.

There are no statues or temples of Talitus as they have no known form or gender, nor are they known to speak to mortals. Very rarely, Talitus will choose a mortal to perform a task, the purposes of these tasks are known only to Talitus.

Somewhat paradoxically, Talitus is perpetually the youngest and oldest entity in the universe. Taltius may be one, many or even none. Scholars have spent centuries trying to understand the very few clues they have about Talitus.

Talitus worship is deeply taboo across the entire Caligos Archipelago. Worshipping them is seen as praying for the death of everything, including the gods. In the Caligos Imperium, any evidence implying worship of Talitus is an instant death sentence.

feat.name: Tinkerer
entries: You are a talented craftsman, able to create contraptions beyond common understanding, you gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two {@filter artificer infusions|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=AI} of your choice from the artificer class (these are added to any existing artificer infusions you know from any other source).  Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one of these Artificer Infusion options with another one from the artificer class.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a nonmagical object and imbue it with one of your artificer infusions (if you can already infuse items, the number of items you can have infused at once is increased by one).

feat.name: Hoplite
entries: You adopt the fighting style of the hoplite, with {@item spear|phb} and {@item shield|phb}. You gain the following benefits:

items: When using a {@item spear|phb} in one hand and a {@item shield|phb} in the other, the weapon's damage die changes as if you wielded the weapon in two hands, from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with spears.
When an ally within 5 feet of you is attacked, you can use your reaction to grant them a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. You must be wielding a {@item shield|phb} to use this feature.

feat.name: Oceanid Warrior
entries: You learn the fighting style of the Oceanids. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you wield a {@item trident|phb} or {@item bident|cyranos}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8} when wielded in one hand, and from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10} when wielded with two hands. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
When you make a melee attack with a {@item trident|phb} or {@item bident|cyranos} against a creature while either of you are underwater, you gain advantage on the attack roll.
Your reach with {@item trident|phb|tridents} or {@item bident|cyranos|bidents} with which you are proficient is increased by 5 feet.

feat.name: Pit Fighter
entries: You have adopted a flashly fighting style that always goes down well with the arena crowds. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you make a weapon attack against a creature, you can use your bonus action gain a bonus to the attack and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Blood Mage Initiate
entries: You can harness the power of your own blood to enhance your spells. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you cast a spell that restores hit points or deals damage to creatures other than you, you can roll {@dice 2d4} and add the number rolled as a bonus to the hit points regained or the damage dealt. You take necrotic damage equal to the number rolled, which can't be reduced in any way.

When you finish a short rest, you can choose to recover expended spell slots. None of the slots can be 6th level or higher and you take necrotic damage equal to five times the combined level of the spell slots, which can't be reduced in any way.

feat.name: Throwing Weapon Master
entries: You have mastered the art of throwing weapons. You gain the following benefits:

items: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls when using a weapon with the thrown property.
You can add your proficiency bonus to any ranged attack rolls when using a weapon with the thrown property even if you are not normally proficient with that weapon.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

feat.name: Whipmaster
entries: You have mastered the art of using whips. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you wield a {@item whip|phb}, its damage die changes from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)
Whips gain the Light property while you wield them.

When you hit creature within 5ft of you with an attack using a whip, you can use your bonus action to take the {@action Grapple} action against that creature. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you cannot use the whip for any other actions.

feat.name: Angelic Healer
entries: The divine energy within you has grown stronger. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your Healing Hands trait as either a bonus action or an action.
You can use your Healing Hands trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses upon finishing a long rest.
When you heal a creature with your Healing Hands trait, the creature you touch regains an additional {@dice 2d4} hitpoints.

feat.name: Angelic Revelation
entries: The divine energy within you has grown stronger. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your Celestial Revelation trait again after finishing a short or long rest. In addtion, when you finish a short or long rest, you can change your Celestial Revelation for a different one.

When you use the Necrotic Shroud or Radiant Consumption revelation, the range is 15ft, rather than 10ft. In addition, when you use the Radiant Soul revelation, your speed is increased by 10ft for the duration of your transformation.

When you, or a creature you can see within 5ft is targeted by an attack roll and you are using your Celestial Revelation trait, you can use a reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll as you obscure the targeted creature with your light or wings.

entries: {@note This feat was designed for use with the {@race aasimar|mpmm} race from Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse. It may require adjustment to work with older versions of the race.}

feat.name: Gunsmith
entries: You have learned how to efficiently create and modify firearms. You gain the following benefits:

items: It takes you half the usual time and gold to craft firearms and bullets.

You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} if you don't already have it. During a long rest you can use smith's tools and expend 100gp worth of materials to {@item rifled firearm|caligos|rifle a firearm} or to produce a {@item firearm scope|caligos}.

At the end of each long rest, with smith's tools in your hand, you can touch one non-magical firearm to grant it a +1 bonus to all attack and damage rolls made with the weapon. This benefit lasts until the end of your next long rest.

feat.name: Volatile Spit
entries: Your spit attacks are stronger than most. You gain the following benefits:

items: Both the normal range and long range of your spit attack are doubled.
The damage die for your spit attack increases from a {@dice d4} to a {@dice d6}.
You can use a bonus action to build up acidic saliva before spitting it. The next time you hit a target with your spit attack within the next minute, you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} acid damage.

feat.name: Magic Initiate (Variant)
entries: You learn two cantrips and one 1st-level spell of your choice. You can cast the chosen 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.
Your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat).

item.name: Satyr's Wine
entries: This sweet wine is made by satyrs from forest fruits grown by dryads. When you drink this wine, you must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you become {@condition charmed} by all creatures that you can see of any species and gender you are normally attracted to. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until you succeed and are no longer {@condition charmed}.

item.name: Hourglass of Kronos
entries: This finely crafted hourglass holds one minute of sand and bears an engraving of a scythe on one side.
The hourglass has 2 charges and regains {@dice 1d3-1} charges daily at dawn.

While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell time stasis|jackalope} spell (save DC 12) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 4th-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: Orb of Helios and Selene
entries: This tiny glass orb sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and shows an image of the sun, during the day, or the moon, during the night.
While holding this orb, you can use an action to read the image and determine whether it is morning, afternoon, evening, or nighttime outside. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

item.name: Sandals of the Styx
entries: These sandals have supposedly been dipped in the river styx at the border of the underworld and thus grant the wearer the powers of Achilles.
While wearing these sandals all non-magical weapon attacks against you have disadvantage.

entries.name: Curse
entries: These sandals are cursed. Attuning to them curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, your attunement to the object cannot be broken, and any successful weapon attacks against you are treated as critical hits.

item.name: Bellerophon's Horn
entries: Once attuned to the horn you can blow it to summon a {@creature pegasus|mm}.
The pegasus is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the pegasus defends itself but takes no other actions.

When the pegasus drops to 0 hit points, it disappears in a cloud of mist, leaving behind no physical form, and cannot be summoned again until dawn the next dawn. You can also dismiss the pegasus at any time as an action, causing it to disappear in the same way.

item.name: Sandals of Atalanta
entries: While you are attuned to and wearing these sandals your walking speed increases by 10ft.

item.name: Wings of Daedalus
entries: While you are attuned to and wearing these wings you gain a flying speed of 30ft.

These wings require both arms to operate and so you cannot use your arms or hands whilst flying or hovering. Whilst on the ground, you can remove your arms from the contraption and use them normally while the wings hang uselessly off your back.

item.name: Helm of Darkness
entries: The helm has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.
As an action, you can expend one charge to cast {@spell greater invisibility|phb} on yourself.

item.name: Nemean Lion Pelt
entries: While wearing this pelt, you have resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
This pelt cannot be worn over medium or heavy armor.

item.name: Spear of Kelphalos
entries: This weapon has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you miss a ranged attack with this weapon you can expend one charge to hit instead, this hit cannot be a critical hit.

item.name: Hippolyta's Girdle
entries: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 21. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.
This item has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.

As an action, you can expend one charge to cast the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|phb} spell on yourself without providing material components. You have advantage on saving throws to maintain concentration for this casting.

item.name: Bolt of Zeus
entries: Crafted by the cyclopes, this crackling, golden bolt holds the power of zeus

This item has {@dice 3d4} charges when it is found. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell lightning bolt|phb} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

If you expend the bolt's last charge roll a d20. On a 1, the bolt explodes and deals {@dice 8d6} lightning damage to all creatures within 10ft. If the roll is not a 1, the bolt crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Necklace of Beards
entries: While wearing this necklace a creature's beard grows by half an inch after each long rest, even if they could not normally grow a beard.

item.name: Ring of Theatrics
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell thaumaturgy|phb} as an action.

item.name: Ring of Tricks
entries: While wearing this ring, you can cast {@spell prestidigitation|phb} as an action.

item.name: Gloves of the Gardener
entries: While wearing these gloves, you can cast {@spell druidcraft|phb} as an action.

item.name: Shield Strap
entries: This leather strap can be used to hang a {@item shield|phb} from your shoulder. When using it in this manner, you may don or doff the shield as a bonus action rather than an action.

item.name: Buckler
entries: This small shield is made from wood or metal and is strapped to the forearm, leaving the hand free. Wielding a buckler increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one shield or buckler at a time. You cannot use weapons with the two handed property while wielding this buckler.

item.name: Pepperbox Pistol
entries: {@b {@i Multi-Barrel.}} When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Pepperbox Musket
entries: {@b {@i Multi-Barrel.}} When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Duckfoot Pistol
entries: This advanced firearm design features several barrels placed at different angles alongside each other, resembling a duck's foot. When the trigger is pulled, all barrels fire simultaneously casting a wide arc of bullets.

{@b {@i Wide-Shot.}} When you make an attack with this weapon, you do not target a single creature. Instead every creature within a 30ft cone originating from the weapon must make a Dexterity saving throw, or take the damage of this weapon. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Dexterity bonus + your proficiency bonus if you are proficient with this weapon. This action uses five pieces of ammunition.

item.name: Blunderbuss
entries: This advanced firearm design features a wide flared barrel in which multiple bullets can fit. When the trigger is pulled, all bullets are fired simultaneously.

{@b {@i Improvised-Ammunition.}} This weapon can be loaded with any ten tiny objects, such as gravel or ball bearings. When you do so, any creature targeted by an attack from this weapon has advantage on the saving throw to avoid being hit. The damage for this kind of attack is {@dice 1d4}.

{@b {@i Wide-Shot.}} When you make an attack with this weapon, you do not target a single creature. Instead every creature within a 30ft cone originating from the weapon must make a Dexterity saving throw, or take the damage of this weapon. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Dexterity bonus + your proficiency bonus if you are proficient with this weapon. This action uses five pieces of ammunition.

item.name: Legionsbane Pistol
entries: This heavy steel pistol is the personal sidearm of Maximilian Steinhauser Von Stahlnich II, war hero and High Chancellor of Gaulsberg. It has seen many conflicts and seen much use.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon superheats bullets it fires, dealing an extra {@dice 2d6} fire damage on a hit.

{@b {@i Multi-Barrel.}} When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to make an additional attack with this weapon. This attack ignores the loading property of this weapon.

item.name: Grand Inquisitor's Baculus
entries: This black and silver halberd is a symbol of office for the Grand Inquisitor of the Caligos Imperium. While this weapon is mostly ceremonial, it is still a functional and formidable weapon.
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Once per turn, this weapon can channel the power of the Iuris Legion deal an extra {@dice 2d10} radiant damage on a hit.
When you make an attack with thise weapon, you can choose to make a normal melee attack or a ranged attack using the statistics of a {@item pepperbox pistol|Caligos}.

item.name: Inquisitor Mask
entries: This leather and metal mask features goggles and a beak is worn by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium.. While wearing this mask, you are immune to the {@condition blinded|phb} condition.

item.name: Inquisitor Coat
entries: This long, dark coat is worn by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

item.name: Inquisition Enforcer's Cane
entries: This elegant, black cane is topped with a metalic bird head and is wielded by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. This particular cane was wielded by an Inquisition Enforcer.

As a bonus action you can transform this cane into a weapon of your choice with which you are proficient. The weapon can be any {@filter melee weapon that lacks the light and special properties|items|type=!futuristic;melee weapon;!modern;!treasure|property=!light;!special|miscellaneous=mundane}. You can transform it back into a cane with another bonus action.

item.name: Inquisition Officer's Cane
entries: This elegant, black cane is topped with a metalic bird head and is wielded by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. This particular cane was wielded by an Inquisition Officer.

As a bonus action you can transform this cane into a weapon of your choice with which you are proficient. The weapon can be any {@filter melee weapon that lacks the two-handed and special properties|items|type=!futuristic;melee weapon;!modern;!treasure|property=!special;!two-handed|miscellaneous=mundane}. You can transform it back into a cane with another bonus action.

item.name: Inquisition Sharpshooter's Cane
entries: This elegant, black cane is topped with a metalic bird head and is wielded by members of the Inquisition within the Caligos Imperium. This particular cane was wielded by an Inquisition Sharpshooter.

As a bonus action you can transform this cane into a weapon of your choice with which you are proficient. The weapon can be any {@filter ranged weapon that lacks the special property|items|type=!futuristic;!modern;range;!treasure|property=!special|miscellaneous=mundane}. You can transform it back into a cane with another bonus action.

item.name: Firearm Bullet
entries: This paper cartridge contains a basic lead bullet and a precise measure of black powder for optimal usage with most firearms.

item.name: Piercing Bullet
entries: This paper cartridge contains a specially designed lead bullet and a precise measure of black powder for optimal usage with most firearms.

You gain a +5 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of specialised ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is destroyed. If the target is a creature, you subtract {@dice 1d4+1} from the attack's damage roll (to a minimum of 1).

item.name: Fragmentation Bullet
entries: This paper cartridge contains a specially designed lead bullet and a precise measure of black powder for optimal usage with most firearms.

You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls made with this piece of specialised ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is destroyed. If the target is a creature, you add a {@dice 1d4+1} bonus to the attack's damage roll.

item.name: Bullet Pouch
entries: This pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets}, {@item firearm bullet|caligos|firearm bullets}, {@item piercing bullet|caligos|piercing bullets} or {@item fragmentation bullet|caligos|fragmentation bullets}. The pouch weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents. Drawing a bullet from the pouch does not require an action.

item.name: Bottomless Bullet Pouch
entries: This pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets}, {@item firearm bullet|caligos|firearm bullets}, {@item piercing bullet|caligos|piercing bullets} or {@item fragmentation bullet|caligos|fragmentation bullets}. The pouch weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents. Drawing a bullet from the pouch does not require an action.

Additionally, You can place a nonmagical bullet in the pouch. From then on, whenever the bullet is removed, a perfect duplicate is created inside the pouch, effectively providing an unlimited supply of that particular bullet. As an action, you can permanently remove a bullet, preventing it from creating any further duplicates.

item.name: Firearm Scope
entries: This set of carefully crafted lenses makes aiming at long range easier. You can spend 10 minutes afixing this scope to a firearm with the Two-Handed property, after which attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls with this weapon. This does not have any effect on firearms with the Wide-Shot property.

item.name: Bayonet
entries: This blade can be fixed to any firearm with the Two-Handed property as an action. The blade can then be used to make a melee weapon attack as part of an {@action attack} action. This attack has the Finese property. On a hit, this attack deals {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

item.name: Homing Ink Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a series of runic sigils. Each sigil corresponds to a particular teleportation circle that you know. Whenever you commit a circle's sigil to memory, the sigil is added to the design of this tattoo.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Stored Circles.}} You can use this tattoo to cast the {@spell teleportation circle} spell without expending a spell slot (you must still provide the material components). Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Springstep Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a coil like pattern rising up your ankles and calves.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Eldritch Leap.}} You can use this tattoo to cast the {@spell jump} spell on yourself as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Strong Grip Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features muscle like patterns.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Robust Grasp.}} While attuned to this item and wielding a weapon with the Versatile property in one hand, the weapon's damage die changes as if you wielded the weapon in two hands. (This benefit has no effect if another feature has already improved the weapon's die.)

item.name: Loyalty Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features twisting and looping patterns.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Bonded Weapon.}} You can perform a ritual to bond with a weapon you touch over the course of an hour, this can be done during a short rest. You can only bond to one weapon at a time. So long as the bonded weapon is within 60ft of you, you can use a bonus action to summon it to your hand via the most direct route.
Any creatures that would be hit by the weapon on its path to your hand, must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} of the weapon's damage type.

item.name: Burning Fist Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features glowing flame like patterns.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Magical Strikes.}} While the tattoo is on your skin, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes.

{@b {@i Flaming Punch.}} This tattoo has 6 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d6} charges daily at dawn. As a bonus action, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell searing smite|phb} spell without expending a spell slot. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. For 2 charges, you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell. The effects of the spell only apply to your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Wild Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features a chaotic and colourful pattern that never seems to look the same each time you look at it.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Chaotic Reserves.}} As an action you can roll {@dice 1d6-1} and recover expended spell slots with a combined level that is equal to or less than the result of the roll. If the result is a 0, you must instead roll a Wild Magic Surge. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Far Tether Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features the design of a dart or arrow on the hand with the image of a rope or chain tightly coiled up the forearm.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.
{@b {@i Assisted Grasp.}} When you take the {@action grapple} or {@action shove} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to gain advantage on the Strength (Athletics) check.

{@b {@i Far Reach.}} As a bonus action, you can cast the {@spell runner's rope|jackalope} spell without expending a spell slot or providing material components. Once you use this bonus action, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Subdermal Chain Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features spiralling patterns of chains, ropes, vines or webs.

{@b {@i Tattoo Attunement.}} To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin. If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

{@b {@i Chain Weapon.}} While the tattoo is on your skin, you can summon a chain to your free hand as a bonus action, or as part of an attack you make with the chain. You can dismiss the chain again as a bonus action. You cannot be disarmed of the chain.

The chain is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and reach properties. On a hit, it deals bludgeoning or slashing (your choice) damage equal to {@dice 1d8} plus the ability modifier you used for the attack roll. The chain counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Alternatively, when you summon the chain, you can attach it to a melee weapon that lacks the two-handed or heavy property. The weapon gains the reach property while the chain is attached.

item.name: Arcane Enhancement Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo can enhance your abilities. Choose an ability, when you get this tattoo, your chosen ability score is permanently increased by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 22 using this tattoo.

item.name: Xerc's Tin Foil Hat
entries: This tin foil hat is not actually magical in any way but if the wearer believes strongly enough that it is, it grants them advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition frightened|phb}.

item.name: Xerc's Medicinal Cheese
entries: This foul smelling cheese appears to be covered in cat hairs and can be used to restore vitality...somehow.
When a creature consumes this cheese as a bonus action, they can instantly expend and roll one Hit Die, they then regain hit points equal to the result of the roll + their Constitution modifier.

item.name: Wild Magic Faggot
entries: This odd bundle of twigs from unknown, magical plants can be used in place of a wand.
This item has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
When you use this wand to cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can expend any number of charges to gain a bonus to the spell's attack rolls. The bonus is equal to the number of charges expended.
Whenever charges are expended, you trigger a Wild Magic Surge.

item.name: Boots of Dramatic Hovering
entries: These boots allow you to hover dramatically up to 1 foot above the ground as a bonus action. Whilst hovering, you move as if you were walking. The boots do not grant you a flying speed or any protection from terrain, falls or traps.

item.name: Scroll of Unique Wish
entries: This scroll allows a creature to cast the {@spell wish|phb} spell. In addition to the usual drawbacks of the spell, if the creature's wish has ever been wished before, the wish fails and instead summons an {@creature avatar of death|dmg} that is hostile to the creature. The Dungeon Master decides if the wish is unique. Whether the wish suceeds or fails, the scroll burns up and can't be used again.

item.name: Poppy of Hypnos
entries: When this poppy blooms, or takes damage, it releases a potent mist. All creatures within range are targeted by the {@spell sleep|phb} spell at 2nd level. The poppy then wilters and can not cast the spell again.

item.name: Molly
entries: This white flowering herb is known for protecting Odysseus from the witch Circe. Any creature that consumes the herb, is immune to the effects of the {@spell polymorph|phb}, {@spell true polymorph|phb} and {@spell mass polymorph|xge} spells for the next 8 hours.

item.name: Temporal Gearbox
entries: This set of incrementally larger gears connected to a crank can be used to imprison a creature in a slower timestream. As an action you can point this device at a creature and turn the crank, forcing the creature to make a DC12 Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, the creature's perception of time is slowed to the speed where a single heartbeat takes a year (one round in combat takes 6 years).

The creature can act normally but only at their usual speed, even a quick action such as blinking can appear to take weeks or even months. For this reason, this device is commonly used as a torture device. The Dungeon Master decides how this experience affects the creature; rolling for one or more {@variantrule Madness|dmg} effects would be appropriate.

On subsequent turns, you can use an action to continue turning the crank, keeping the effect going. Otherwise, the effect lasts until the start of your next turn. At the end of each of it's turns, the creature can attempt to make the wisdom saving throw again, breaking free on a success. Once a creature has succeeded on a saving throw, it cannot be affected by this item again for 7 days.

item.name: Anti-Magic Collar
entries: This silver collar can be clasped onto a creature that has a neck and is {@condition incapacitated} as an action. While the clasp is shut, the creature cannot cast any spells.

The collar cannot be removed by changing size or shape, such as with the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell. Provided it has two hands free to do so, the creature can use an action on each of its turns to make a DC 15 Strength check. On a success, the collar is broken and becomes non-magical. On a fail, the creature gains a level of exhaustion and the collar remains.

item.name: Cruel Anti-Magic Collar
entries: This special {@item Anti-Magic Collar|jackalope} can be clasped onto a creature that has a neck and is {@condition incapacitated} as an action. While the clasp is shut, the creature cannot cast any spells. If it attempts to do so, it takes {@dice 1d6} lightning damage per level of the spell ({@dice 1d6} for cantrips).

The collar cannot be removed by changing size or shape, such as with the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell. Provided it has two hands free to do so, the creature can use an action on each of its turns to make a DC 18 Strength check. On a success, the collar is broken and becomes non-magical. On a fail, the creature gains a level of exhaustion and the collar remains.

item.name: Ice Skates
entries: These special boots each feature a blade with which the wearer can glide over ice. You can don or doff these boots over 1 minute.

While wearing these boots, slippery ice is no longer considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for you but all other terrain is. In addition, if you are not travelling uphill, moving 2 feet on slippery ice only costs 1 foot of movement for you.

item.name: Ge Bulg
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

As an action, you can perform a special ranged attack with this weapon by kicking it towards a creature. On a hit, this weapon impales the creature and opens thirty barbs, making it very difficult to remove. While impaled, a creature takes {@dice 2d6} piercing damage for every 10 feet it travels. When used in this way, the Ge Bulg cannot be used for this type of attack again until the next dawn.

The Ge Bulg can be removed from an impaled creature, or its corpse, with either a DC 18 Strength (Athletics) or Wisdom (Medicine) check as an action. On a fail, the creature takes {@dice 4d6} piercing damage and the creature is still impaled. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and the Ge Bulg is removed.

item.name: Shield of Bouncing
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
In additon to a simple melee weapon, this weapon can be used as a {@item shield|phb}, granting a +2 bonus to your armor class if you are wielding no other shield.
Additionally, when you make a ranged attack using this weapon, the weapon bounces back to your hand after the attack.

item.name: Wheelchair
entries: This contraption grants mobility to those who may be impaired due to injuries, disabilities or curses.
{@b {@i Size.}} Your wheelchair is designed for you and is the same size as you. If a magic effect or spell changes your size, the chair changes with you.

{@b {@i Speed.}} While sitting in a wheelchair, you effectively have a base walking speed of 30ft, regardless of your race. If a magic effect or spell changes your walking speed, your speed in the chair also changes. If you have a climb, swim or fly speeds, these are not affected by the chair. Seatbelts ensure that the chair comes with you however you move.
{@b {@i Poor Mobility.}} Terrain that is not flat and firm, such as mud or sand, is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

{@b {@i Gravity.}} Travelling up steep inclines or stairs counts as {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for you when in the chair. When travelling down steep inclines or stairs, you can travel 2 feet for every 1 foot of movement used.
{@b {@i Magic Effects and Features.}} The wheelchair is considered part of you for the purposes of by magic effects, features, items or spells, any effects on you also effect the chair.

{@b {@i Upgrading the Wheelchair.}} Using a set of {@item tinker's tools|phb} over 1 hour, a creature can afix, or remove, wheelchair upgrades. A wheelchair cannot have more than four upgrades at once. If a wheelchair has multiple upgrades that require attunement, you may treat the wheelchair as a single item for the purposes of attunement.

entries.name: Handsfree Variant
entries: If you also have limited use of your hands and arms, the DM may allow you a specialised chair that allows you to replicate the functions of hands.

You have telepathic control over one or two pseudo hands that function indentically to regular arms and hands. These could be mechanical arms attached to the chair, spectral hands floating around the chair or some other form that you and the DM decide upon. You may use any combination of regular hands and pseudo hands but can not have more than two total at any one time, unless you gain them from another source.

item.name: All-terrain Wheels
entries: This set of wheels come with a kit of spikes, snow chains and special tyres that can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. You can ignore the Poor Mobility property of the wheelchair as the wheels can traverse the terrain as easily as with legs.
This upgrade can not be afixed at the same time as the {@item Racing Wheels|JWC} upgrade.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Racing Wheels
entries: This set of lightweight, narrow wheels can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. Your base walking speed is increased by 10ft when not on {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.
This upgrade can not be afixed at the same time as the {@item All-terrain Wheels|JWC} upgrade.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Hoverstone
entries: This magic gemstone can be fixed to the armrest of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}, granting you the ability to hover the chair a few inches above the ground. You can use a bonus action to start or stop hovering. While hovering, you ignore the Gravity property of the wheelchair as you glide up and down inclines and stairs.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. Activating or deactivating the stone can be done as part of the same bonus action used to command the chair to move.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Floats
entries: This series of inflable bladders can be used to float the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. As an action you can inflate, or deflate, the bladders to make the chair float on water. While the bladders are inflated, you have a swim speed of 30ft (unless you already have a higher swim speed from another source) and you can not descend underwater but your walking speed is halved.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. You can use an action to telepathically command the bladders to inflate or deflate.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Spider Legs
entries: This foldable set of mechanical spider legs can fit snuggly on the underside of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. As an action, you can deploy the legs for 1 hour or until you retract them as an action. While the legs are deployed, you gain a climb speed of 30ft (unless you already have a higher climb speed from another source) and ignore the Poor Mobility and Gravity properties of the wheelchair. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. You can use an action to telepathically command the legs to deploy or retract.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Greater Hoverstone
entries: This magic gemstone can be fixed to the armrest of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}, granting you the ability to make the chair fly. As an action, you can activate the stone for 1 hour or until you deactive it as an action. While the stone is activated, you have a fly speed of 30ft (unless you already have a higher fly speed from another source). Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until the next dawn.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. You can use an action to telepathically command the stone to activate or deactivate.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Weapon Mount
entries: This special pivoting mount can be fixed to the armrest of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. You can spend 1 minute to mount, or remove, a single melee weapon, a {@item light crossbow|phb} or a {@item heavy crossbow|phb}. You can only mount one weapon in this way at once. While mounted, the weapon can be used as normal but does not cost an action to draw or stow the weapon and you cannot be disarmed of the weapon so long as you are in the chair.
{@note If your DM allows, you may also mount firearms using this upgrade.}
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade and has a melee weapon mounted, you add that weapon's melee attacks to the wheelchair's statblock.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Armored Plates
entries: These heavy plates can offer you some extra cover for a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. While you are in the chair, you gain a +2 to AC.
You also gain disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in the chair.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Ram
entries: This heavy ram can be afixed to front of a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. This can be used as a {@item portable ram|phb}.

Additionally, if you move at least 10 feet in a straight line toward a creature or object that is not larger than you, you can make a special melee weapon attack against them in which you crash into them with the ram. You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength modifier as bludgeoning damage, the target must also make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, and you are not in the wheelchair, it gains the benefits of this upgrade rather than you. Addtionally, you add the attack granted by this upgrade to the wheelchair's statblock.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Heavy Wheels
entries: These heavy lead wheels can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. When you are within 5 feet of a creature that is not larger than you and {@condition prone|phb}, you can make a special melee weapon attack against them in which you roll over them. You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d8} plus your Strength modifier as bludgeoning damage. If you are at least one size larger than the creature, you add an addtional {@dice 1d4} to the damage dealt.
If the wheelchair also has the {@item Remote Beacon|JWC} upgrade, you add the attack granted by this upgrade to the wheelchair's statblock.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Remote Beacon
entries: This magic gemstone can be afixed to a {@item wheelchair|JWC}. While attuned, so long as the chair is on the same plane as you, you always know where it is.

If you are not in the chair, it is treated as an {@creature Animated object (Medium)|phb}. It cannot act on its own but, if it is within 100ft of you, you may use a bonus action to telepathically command it to move up to its full movement. Addtionally, you can use an action to command the chair to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge} or {@action Hide} action.
Additional upgrades afixed to this wheelchair may grant further actions, see respective upgrade descriptions for more information.

If the wheelchair is reduced to 0 hitpoints, the wheelchair is not destroyed but the beacon becomes inert and will not respond to any commands until it is repaired over 1 hour with {@item tinker's tools} or with the {@spell mending|phb} cantrip.
{@b {@i Wheelchair Upgrade.}} This item is an upgrade for the {@item wheelchair|JWC}. See the wheelchair statblock for information on adding or removing upgrades.

item.name: Longshoreman's Hook
entries: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|phb}. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

item.name: Chronicles of Alvergia
entries: This heavy tome is part of a 12 volume compendium written by Annaleus of Rubin and contains information about the geography, politics, cultures, wildlife, theologies and cultures of the regions within Alvergia. Most versions are written in either common or elvish but versions can exist in most written languages. Each volume is worth about 25gp and covers a specific region in Alvergia, but the entire collection as a set is worth about 1000gp.

When you possess a volume of the book you may ask the DM for a piece of lore relating to the volume's respective region and they may give you some tidbits. For example, you could ask for details regarding a particular god or about the laws and customs of a city. The information should be something that a well researched scholar would know and deem worthy to mention. The DM may decide that a topic is too specific, insignificant or secret to appear in the volumes. They may also decide that a topic is broad enough to require several hours, or even days, of reading to fully understand it.
Below are the regions covered by each volume.

rows: Vol. I
The Sea of Cyranos
Vol. II
Enereon and Brindsmarch
Vol. III
The Evandrin Isles
Vol. IV
Ilahli
Vol. V
The Northlands
Vol. VI
Solis
Vol. VII
The Empire of Telnyr
Vol. VIII
The Pelais Coast and the Feywild
Vol. IX
The Plains of Vorkyr
Vol. X
The Dunes of Xheros
Vol. XI
Xia and the Forest of Muhai
Vol. XII
The Oceans and Lonely Islands

item.name: Tome of Many Cheeses
entries: This slightly damp catalogue of different types of cheeses has a funny smell. As an action, you can choose one of the cheeses listed and summon up to 5lbs of that type of cheese in a space adjacent to you. The cheese disappears if it is not consumed within 24 hours. Once you summon cheese, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.
In addition, whenever you find a new form of non-magical cheese, you can spend 10 minutes describing it on a new page in the book. It can then be summoned using the book.

item.name: Assassin's Teapot
entries: This specially designed teapot features two separate compartments that can hold different liquids, such as tea and poison. It also features a pair of secret holes on the handle, with which you to control which liquid is poured by covering specific holes. When you pour from this teapot, choose one or both of the liquids to be poured.
You have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to avoid creatures noticing anything usual about the way you pour the teapot.

item.name: Hydra Blood
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or {@condition incapacitated|phb} {@creature hydra|mm}. You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d6} poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: Cloak of Endless Poultry
entries: This feathered cloak holds some form of gateway to a demi plane full of chickens. The cloak has 5 charges, it regains {@dice 1d6-1} charges daily at dawn.

As an action you can expend a charge and open the cloak and {@dice 1d4} {@creature chicken|jackalope|chickens} fall out into adjacent spaces. The chickens are friendly to you and your allies, they will follow you and may attack any creatures or objects that attack you but are otherwise unable to understand any commands you make. The chickens last for 1 hour or until they die, after which they either enter the cloak again or disappear in a puff of feathers.

item.name: Nautical Bone Charm
entries: This broken bone is inscribed with arcane runes and has 5 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn.

As an action, you can expend a number of charges to cast the {@spell Spectral Crew|jackalope} spell. For 1 charge, you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

item.name: +1 Pugilist Bracers
entries: While wearing these leather bracers, you have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes.
In addition, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

item.name: +2 Pugilist Bracers
entries: While wearing these leather bracers, you have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes.
In addition, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

item.name: +3 Pugilist Bracers
entries: While wearing these leather bracers, you have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes.
In addition, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

item.name: Bottle of Delights
entries: This clear, glass bottle can hold up to a gallon of liquid. When there is liquid in the bottle, you may cast {@spell Bazoz's Spicy Water|jackalope} on the liquid at will.
If you pour the liquid out of the bottle, the effects remain active in the liquid for 1 hour, or until you use the bottle to cast the cantrip again.

item.name: Brine Poison
entries: This poison is harvested from brine pools deep underwater, the extreme salinity is toxic to most creatures. You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d4} poison damage and become {@condition incapacitated|phb} until the end of its next turn. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.
At the DM's discretion, if a creature is not acclimated to high salinity environments, they have disadvantge on the saving throw and take double the poison damage on a fail.

item.name: Silent Hammer
entries: This small, metal hammer produces no noise when used to strike something. The object or creature struck with the hammer also produces no noise as a result of the striking.

item.name: Magic Eyeliner
entries: This eyeliner is imbued with magic powders that grant the wearer benefits for a short duration. As an action, you can apply the eyeliner to a creature. That creature has truesight out to 60ft for the next 8 hours, after which the eyeliner ceases to be magical.

item.name: Ring of False Death
entries: This dark metal ring is popular with spies and criminals. When you take damage, you can use a reaction to cast the {@spell feign death|phb} spell on yourself without providing material components. Once you do so, you can not do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Body Modder's Tools
additionalEntries: Proficiency with body modder's tools represents your ability to safely modify a creature's body with grafts, implants, piercings, scarification and tattoos. You also acquire an understanding of the history and symbolism of body modifications, which can aid you in producing and examining them.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: This kit includes needles, syringes, scalpels, gauze and small bottles of various dyes, inks, disinfectants and other chemicals.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana
entries: You gain additional insight when identifying the materials and patterns used in magic tattoos and other modifications.

additionalEntries.name: History and Religion
entries: You have greater understanding of the cultural and religious significance of certain body modifications.

additionalEntries.name: Medicine
entries: You can recognise and treat infections caused by unclean punctures and wounds. You also have better chances of spotting when a creature's appearance has been nonmagically modified, such as implanted horns or dyed skin.

additionalEntries.name: Modify
entries: As part of a long rest, you can expend at least 10gp worth of materials to perform (or reverse) a body modification on a willing creature, such as a tattoo or piercing. The DM may decide that more complex modifications require more valuable materials.

additionalEntries.caption: Body Modder's Tools
rows: Dye, tattoo or scar a creature's fur or skin.
Give a creature a piercing or expander.
Graft or implant horns, scales, spikes, a tail or other decorative body parts.
Slightly alter the shape of a humanoid's facial features.
Make a humanoid appear as a different but similar race, or as a different sex.

item.name: Ring of Folding
entries: This segmented, metal ring has a surprisingly large interior compartment and can be used to hide weapons.
Over the course of 10 minutes, you can magically fold and store a single weapon inside the ring. You can then use a bonus action to unfold the wepon and summon it to your empty hand.

item.name: Voltaic Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
entries: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level area 10 feet square. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.
