A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw. If a creature in the area takes lightning damage, they take an additional {@dice 1d12} lightning damage.
Additionally, while holding the bag, you can use a bonus action to command any balls within 15ft to magically fly back into the bag via the most direct route.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, you are filled with an overwhelming urge to put one or more of the ball bearings in your mouth. While you do not have any ball bearings in your mouth, you have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws. While you have at least one ball bearing in your mouth, you are vulnerable to lightning damage. You are unwilling to part with all of the balls until the curse is broken with remove curse or similar magic, keeping at least one ball on your person at all times.

item.name: +1 Bloody Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Weapon Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a weapon at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a weapon over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon always appears to be covered in wet blood, and cannot be cleaned of it. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that can see the weapon.

item.name: +1 Glimmering Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Weapon Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a weapon at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a weapon over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon always appears clean and freshly polished with a satisfying sheen. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks against creatures that can see the weapon.

item.name: +1 Charming Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Weapon Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a weapon at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a weapon over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon constantly emits an inaudible resonance that hinders creatures abilities to determine falsehoods. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks against creatures that can see the weapon and are not {@condition deafened}.

item.name: +1 Distracting Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Weapon Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a weapon at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a weapon over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, when you hit a target with this weapon or fire a piece of ammunition from this weapon you can cause the target or ammunition to produce one of the following effects until the start of your next turn.

items: The target or ammunition sheds bright light out to a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.
The target or ammunition emits a whistling noise that can be heard up to 60ft.

item.name: +1 Glamour Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Armor Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor, turning it into magic armor, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a set of armor at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a set of armor over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to alter the colors, sigils and patterns of the armor or to magically clean, dry or soil the armor. As part of the same bonus action, you can all alter any nonmagical clothing you are wearing in the same way. The armor or clothing retains its shape, materials and statistics and the effect ends if you use this bonus action again or you doff it. For example, you may alter a dirty brown tabbard into pristine red and white one bearing the sigil of a particular deity or noble.

item.name: +1 Stubborn Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Armor Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor, turning it into magic armor, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a set of armor at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a set of armor over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, the armor fills your mind with stubborn voices, warning you against manipulitive effects. While attuned, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition charmed} condition.

item.name: +1 Bolstering Runestone
entries: {@b {@i Armor Runestone.}} Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor, turning it into magic armor, if it is not already. Only one runestone can be fused with a set of armor at one time. A runestone can be be removed from a set of armor over the course of an hour. The DM may decide that a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to fuse or remove runestones, or that only a specialist runesmith can do it.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.
Additionally, the armor fills your mind with reassuring voices, helping you maintain your courage. While you have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition frightened} condition.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Amazon Huntress has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Amazon Huntress hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amazon Huntress makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Amazon Warrior has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Amazon Warrior hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Amazon Warrior makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to makes a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Amazon Warrior adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Amazon Hoplite must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) blugeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up Maggots
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoplite makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}), piercing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoplite makes two attacks with its longbow or kopis.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Serve the Master
entries: The warforged knows a humanoid creature as its master. The warforged must protect the master with its life, and must obey the master's every order, unless it directly threatens the life of the master.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

action.name: Armblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Protect The Master
entries: When a creature makes an attack roll against the warforged's master and the warforged is able to reach them using their remaining movement, the warforged can use their reaction and their movement to block the incoming attack, taking the hit (or miss) themselves. The warforged's AC is used to determine if the attack hits or misses.

action.name: Final Protocol
entries: When all hope is lost, the warforged can perform one final act to hinder their enemies. The warforged can overload their core to explode.

Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the warforged must make a DC12 Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This action kills the warforged and shatters their body into a thousand pieces.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Warforged Horse
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}. If the target is {@condition prone|phb}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) blugeoning damage.

monster.name: Warforged Boar
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Warforged Dog
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|phb} and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone|phb}.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the jackalope can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Familiar
entries: With the DM's permission, the {@spell find familiar|phb} spell can summon a jackalope.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The jackalope has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Ventriloquy
entries: The jackalope can cast the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip at will without providing somatic or material components. When it does so, the spell has a range of 60ft but it can only create voices and sounds. The jackalope's spell save DC for this casting is 16.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Bad Flier
entries: The chicken falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

trait.name: Headless
entries: If the chicken is reduced to 0 hit points by non-magical damage, it does not die immediately. Instead, it remains alive but headless for {@dice 1d4} rounds, or until it takes additional damage from any source. While headless, the chicken is {@condition blinded|phb}, {@condition deafened|phb}, cannot use its peck attack, cannot restore hit points and must move at least 20ft in a random direction on each of its turns.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Draconic Essence
entries: Choose a damage type; acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. The chosen type determines the dragon's damage immunity and the damage type for several other traits.
If the dragon gains immunity to poison damage from this trait, it is recommended that it also gains immunity to the poisoned condition.

trait.name: Destructive Maw (Mauler Only)
entries: The dragon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage with its bite attack. The extra damage is of the type associated with the dragon's Draconic Essence trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks (Mauler Only)
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with its bite attack.

trait.name: Enhanced Breath Weapons (Breathmaster Only)
entries: The dragon has +1 bonus to the DC for its breath weapons.
In addition, if the dragon can cast spells, it has a +1 bonus to its spell save DC.

trait.name: Enhanced Defence (Relentless Only)
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to its Armor Class and saving throws.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (Relentless Only, Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If damage would reduce the dragon to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1 hit point.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Dragon Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is of the type associated with the dragon's Draconic Essence trait.

items.name: Secondary Breath (Breathmaster Only)
entries: The dragon has a second breath weapon (chosen when the dragon is created) from the Secondary Breath Weapons table below.

When the dragon uses its secondary breath, it makes an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} saving throw, the type of which is determined by the type of breath weapon. On failed save, a creature is subject to the associated effect shown in the table.

rows: Depriving Breath
Constitution

On a failed save, the creature the creature is either {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened} (dragon's choice) for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition
Forceful Breath
Strength
On a failed save, the creature is moved 15 feet towards or away from the dragon (dragon's choice).
Immobilizing Breath
Constitution
On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.
Pheremone Breath
Wisdom

On a failed save, the creature the creature is either {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by the dragon (dragon's choice) for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.
Sleep Breath
Constitution
On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.
Weakening Breath
Wisdom

On a failed save, the creature must subtract {@dice 1d6} from any attack rolls or ability checks it makes for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

variant.name: Custom Dragons
entries: This statblock is designed to be used to create dragons to fit your worlds and stories. You are encouraged to add your own flavor to each dragon you create, possibly even adding additional text to certain traits. For example, a dragon with Immobilizing Breath could be exhaling frost to freeze creatures in place, slowing time in the area or filling the area with an incapacitating toxin.

To add even more unique flair to a dragon, consider adding one or more {@filter additional draconic traits|optionalfeatures|source=erlw;jackalope;caligos;phb;tce;xge;jdragon|feature type=draconic traits}.

entries: The dragon is immune to disease. It also does not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

trait.name: Energy Conduit
entries: When the dragon would take lightning damage, it can use a reaction to absorb part of the energy for a future attack. When the dragon next deals damage of the same type before the end of its next turn, it can deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the same type.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage and 6 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Dragon Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Destructive Maw
entries: The dragon deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage with its bite attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with its bite, claw and tail attacks (included in the attacks).

trait.name: Construct Design
entries: The dragon is immune to disease. It also does not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

trait.name: Energy Conduit
entries: When the dragon would take lightning damage, it can use a reaction to absorb part of the energy for a future attack. When the dragon next deals damage of the same type before the end of its next turn, it can deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the same type.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Dragon Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 25}):

trait.name: Destructive Maw
entries: The dragon deals an extra {@dice 2d12} damage with its bite attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks
entries: The dragon has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with its bite, claw and tail attacks (included in the attacks).

trait.name: Construct Design
entries: The dragon is immune to disease. It also does not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

trait.name: Energy Conduit
entries: When the dragon would take lightning damage, it can use a reaction to absorb part of the energy for a future attack. When the dragon next deals damage of the same type before the end of its next turn, it can deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the same type.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d10 + 11}) piercing damage and 13 ({@damage 2d12}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d8 + 11}) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d10 + 11}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Dragon Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales destructive energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 ({@damage 13d12}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

optionalfeature.name: Pact Gunsmith
entries: You can create a pact weapon that takes on the form of a firearm. The table below shows you which firearms you can create at each warlock level.

rows: 3rd
{@item matchlock musket|caligos}, {@item matchlock pistol|caligos}, {@item wheellock musket|caligos}, {@item wheellock pistol|caligos}
5th
{@item flintlock musket|caligos}, {@item flintlock pistol|caligos}
7th
{@item pepperbox musket|caligos}, {@item pepperbox pistol|caligos}
9th
{@item gun weapon|caligos}, {@item heavy gun weapon|caligos}

entries: Additionally, you can transform any magical firearm into your pact weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Doomerang
entries: You can cast the {@spell Boomerang Blade|Jackalope} cantrip at will using one of your pact weapons. When you do so the range of the attack is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.
Choose one of the following damage types when creating the weapon: acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.

This weapon has 4 charges. When making a weapon attack with this weapon, you can expend one charge to deal an additional {@dice 1d6} of the chosen damage type. The weapon regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Fighting
entries: All melee weapons that lack the heavy, two handed or special properties gain the finesse property when you wield them.

optionalfeature.name: Akimbo Shooting
entries: You can engage in two-weapon fighting even if one or both weapons are ranged. In addition, you do not need a hand free to load ammunition into ranged weapons (you still require two hands to use weapons with the two-handed property).

optionalfeature.name: Prone Fighting
entries: Being prone does not impose disadvantage on your attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Shield
entries: Your patron gives you a special pact shield, which you can summon to an empty hand as an action. You choose the appearance and material of the shield when you create it, and it grants you a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus when you wield it, unless it is a magic shield that already grants you a higher bonus. You are proficient with the shield, and you cannot be disarmed of it against your will.

Your pact shield disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the shield (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform a magic shield you find into your pact shield by performing a ritual over the course of an hour. This ritual can be done during a short or long rest. The shield then appears whenever you summon your pact shield thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient shield in this way. The shield ceases being your pact shield if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different shield, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The shield appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Shield
entries: You can use your pact shield as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
Additionally, you can summon the shield to your empty hand as a reaction to being targeted by an attack. The AC bonus granted by the shield can be used against the triggering attack.

optionalfeature.name: Guardian Shield
entries: If a creature you can see within 30ft is targeted by an attack roll, and you are wielding your pact shield, you can use a reaction to teleport to a space adjacent to them and add the AC boost granted by the shield to the creature's AC until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the creature is ever more than 5 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Oversized Shield
entries: As an action, you can grow your shield up to 10ft tall and wide and plant it in the ground. Any creatures behind the shield can use it for cover as if it were a solid wall. While in this form, you can not move the shield, and it is treated as an object with an AC equal to 14 + your proficiency bonus and a number of hit points equal to five times your proficiency bonus. The shield will remain in place for 1 minute or until it is reduced to 0 hit points, after which it disappears. It disappears early if you summon it back to your hand at its regular size or until it disappears by the normal rules of pact shields.

optionalfeature.name: Feather Shield
entries: When you fall while holding your pact shield, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling. You can allow other creatures, that are your size or smaller, to hold onto you and slow their own descent in the same manner.

optionalfeature.name: Immovable Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell Immovable Object|egw} spell on your pact shield using a warlock spell slot. You do not provide material components when you do so.

optionalfeature.name: Floating Shield
entries: You can cast the {@spell Tenser's Floating Disk|phb} spell at will without expending a spell slot or providing material components. When you do so, your pact shield becomes the disk. The spell ends early if you summon the shield back to your hand.

optionalfeature.name: Offensive Shield
entries: Your pact shield becomes a melee weapon with the finesse, light and thrown properties with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. You are proficient with attacks with the shield. The shield's damage die for attacks is a {@dice d6}, and the attacks deal bludgeoning damage. You also gain the following benefits.

items: Attacks with the shield count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
When you make a ranged attack using the shield, the shield returns to your hand immediately after the attack.
If you make a critical hit with the shield, you may immediately make an additional attack with the shield.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Shield
entries: Choose one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant or thunder. While wielding your pact shield, you are resistant to the chosen damage type.
In addition, when a creature hits you with a melee attack while you are wielding your pact shield, you can use a reaction to deal {@dice 1d6} damage of the chosen type to them.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Blast
entries: When you cast Eldritch Blast, you can change the damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. If you cast multiple beams, you can choose the damage type of each beam individually.

optionalfeature.name: Wings of Flight

item: A Backpack, Cloak or Suit of Armor (requires attunement)

entries: This pair of wood, leather and metal wings grants the wearer a fly speed of 20ft, provided they are not wearing heavy armor. In addition, the wearer has advantage on Dexterity saving throws while being held aloft by these wings.
This fly speed increases to 30ft when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Tool

item: a set of artisan tools or a musical instrument

entries: This magic tool or instrument grants a +2 bonus to ability checks made using it.
This bonus increases to +4 when you reach 10th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Cavalier
entries: You can cast the {@spell find steed|phb} spell at will.

optionalfeature.name: Alternative Abilty Scores
entries: Some dragons may find their power in the gathering of knowledge rather than the strength of their personality. For example, a papyrus dragon's greatest strength is its vast knowledge. As such, its Intelligence and Charisma scores are swapped to better reflect its nature.

Swap the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma score for that of a different ability from the same list.  The DC for the dragon's traits (excluding spellcasting) do not change as a result of theis trait.

optionalfeature.name: Alternative Creature Type
entries: Sometimes, just because it looks and acts like a dragon, doesn't mean it it actually is one. For example, a tree dragon's soul is bound to a specific tree and it is made of awakened wood. As such, its creature type is plant rather than dragon.
Change the dragon's creature type to another of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Bad Flier
entries: Not all dragons are good fliers, the dragon may have damaged wings or be inexperienced with them. For example, a cave dragon may have never had the space to properly utilize its wings, leading them to atrophy.
Half the dragon's flying speed and add the follwoing trait to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Bad Flier.}} The dragon falls at the end of each of its turns if the only thing holding it aloft is its fly speed.

optionalfeature.name: Burrower
entries: Some dragons are adept at digging through loose earth. For example, a desert dragon can burrow through sand dunes as easily as it can walk on top of them.
Add a burrowing speed to the dragon's statblock equal to the dragon's walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Charming Presence
entries: Some dragon may be more alluring than terrifying. For example, a siren dragon might sing to charm those around it.
Creatures who fail the saving throw against the dragon's Frightful Presence trait are {@condition charmed} rather than {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Climber
entries: Some dragons are adept at scaling vertical surfaces. For example, a ram dragon can traverse mountain cliffs as easily as gentle plains.
Add a climbing speed to the dragon's statblock equal to the dragon's walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Construct Design
entries: The dragon may have been constructed by magic or science, rather than born. Or perhaps it is composed primarily of inorganic matter. For example, a stone dragon is powered by magic rather than biology, and so is a contruct rather than a dragon.
Make the following changes to the dragon's statblock:

items: The dragon's creature's type is contruct rather than dragon.
The dragon is immune to poison and psychic damage.
The dragon is immune to disease and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
The dragon does not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Diver
entries: Some dragons are adept at swimming. For example, a ram dragon can traverse mountain cliffs as easily as gentle plains.
Add a swimming speed to the dragon's statblock equal to the dragon's walking speed. Also, add the following trait:
{@b {@i Amphibious.}} The dragon can breathe air and water.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Mount
entries: For a multitude of reasons, a dragon may serve as the mount of another creature. For example, a cavalry dragon has bonded with a knight and the pair are a formidable force on the battlefield.
Add the following reaction to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Protect Rider.}} When an attack would target a creature mounted on the dragon, the dragon can use a reaction to force the attack to target it instead.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Conduit
entries: You may decide that a dragon is not only unarmed by certain damage types but can channel the energy into its own attacks. For example, a lava dragon can absorb the heat from lava flows and direct it towards its enemies.
Add the following reaction to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Energy Conduit.}} When the dragon would take damage of a type associated with its Draconic Essence trait, it can use a reaction to absorb part of the energy for a future attack. When the dragon next deals damage of the same type before the end of its next turn, it can deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage of the same type.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Not all dragons trace their origin to the material plane. For example, a fairy dragon may trace their origin, at least in part, to the feywild
Make the following changes to the dragon's statblock:

items: The dragon's creature's type is fey rather than dragon.
The dragon is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.
Magic cannot put the dragon to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Grounded
entries: Not all dragons can fly, either losing the ability to do so or never having it to begin with. For example, a gladiator dragon may have had its wings removed as a wyrmling to prevent it escaping the arena.
Remove the dragon's base flying speed.

optionalfeature.name: Hidecarved
entries: Some dragons carve magical runes on their scales to improve their resilience. For example,
The dragon has one or more Hidecarved Wards, described in chapter 3 of Fizban's Treasury of Dragons.

optionalfeature.name: Immutable Form
entries: A dragon's physical form may be unchangeable. For example, an animated dragon statue cannot have its form physically changed.
Add the following trait to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Immutable Form.}} The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Will
entries: Some dragons posses extrodinary willpower, or none at all. For example, a zombie dragon is no longer truly conscious and cannot be manipulated.
The dragon is immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Minion Master
entries: Some dragons prefer to have underlings work for them. For example, many dragons may command {@creature kobolds|MM|kobold}, however, a forest dragon might command {@creature awakened tree|MM|awakened trees}, or a royal dragon might command dragonborn {@creature knight|MM|knights}.
Choose an appropriate creature that has a CR that is equal to or less than one third of the dragon's own CR. Then add the following action to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Minion Master.}} {@dice 1d4+1} of the chosen creature appear in spaces within 30ft of the dragon. The summoned creatures act as a group immediately after the dragon's turn in initiative and will obey any commands given by the dragon (no action required). The creatures last until they die, are dismissed by the dragon (no action required) or the dragon uses this action again.
Additonally, if the dragon has legendary actions or lair actions, you can allow the dragon to use this trait as a legendary action or lair action.

optionalfeature.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Some dragons have multiple heads. For example, a medusa dragon has multiple serpent-like heads extending from its neck.
Add the following trait to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Multiple Heads.}} The dragon can take one reaction per turn, rather than only one per round. It also has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Fangs
entries: Some dragons can utilize poison to make their attacks more danagerous. For example, an underdark dragon may drink {@item drow poison|dmg}, and deliver the poison to the target of its next bite attack.
Add the following bonus action to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Poison Fangs.}} The dragon can use a bonus action to coat its teeth with poison (as if they were a melee weapon). The next time the dragon hits a creature with its bite attack, that creature is subject to the effects of the poison.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Caster
entries: A dragon may be able to perform magic quickly. For example, an iron dragon can use a legendary action to harden its hide by casting {@spell blade ward|phb} on itself.
Add the following legendary action to the dragon's statblock:

{@b {@i Quick Cast.}} The dragon casts a spell it knows that has a casting time of one action or one bonus action. The number of legendary actions expended is equal to the spell's level (1 for a cantrip).

optionalfeature.name: Secondary Essence
entries: Some dragons possess affinity for multiple forms of destructive energy. For example, a thermal dragon has mastery of heat, both producing and removing it. Both fire and cold damage are associated with its Draconic Essence trait.
Choose a second damage type for the dragon's Draconic Essence trait. When the dragon uses its Dragon Breath or Destructive Maw trait, it choses which of the damage types to deal.

optionalfeature.name: Signature Spellcaster
entries: A dragon might be especially talented at particular spells. For example, a spider dragon can cast the {@spell web|phb} spell at will.

Choose up to 2 spells of 3rd-level or lower. The dragon can cast these spells at will, without providing material components. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is the dragon's spellcasting ability (choose when you select this trait).

optionalfeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Some dragons posses innate magical talents. For example, a black hole dragon may know spells such as {@spell magnify gravity|egw} and {@spell gravity sinkhole|egw}. Meanwhile, a divine dragon may know spells such as {@spell cure wounds|phb} and {@spell greater restoration|phb}.

Choose a number of cantrips and spells up to the dragon's proficiency bonus. The maximum level of each spell known depends on the dragon's age; cantrips only for wyrmlings, 3rd-level or lower for young dragons, 5th-level or lower for adults, 7th-lower or lower for ancients and 9th-level or lower for greatwyrms.

For each spell of 1st-level or higher, the dragon can cast it once per day. The dragon does not need to provide material components for cantrips or spells that it casts. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is the dragon's spellcasting ability (choose when you select this trait).

optionalfeature.name: Telepathy
entries: Some dragons have telepathic abilities. For example, a psionic dragon can communicate with the minds of those around it.
Add the following trait to the dragon's statblock:
{@b {@i Telepathy.}} The dragon can speak telepathically with any other creature within 120ft.

optionalfeature.name: Unusual Size
entries: Some dragons are noticably larger or smaller than expected for their age. For example, a giant dragon may be significantly larger than normal dragons.
Increase or decrease the dragon's size category by one.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thalian Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and fire damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, such as ancient columns or statues, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Deep Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and cold damage.

entries.name: Depth Diver
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Ocean Dwarf Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item net|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, such as ancient columns or statues, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Fenri typically mature around 8 years of age. Fenri rarely live beyond 50 years of age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Fenri tend to be loyal, good boys and girls, tending towards neutral good alignments. However some rebellious and malicious Fenri do exist.

entries.name: Size
entries: Fenri come in many breeds and vary greatly in size, they typically stand between 3 and 7 feet tall and weigh between 50 and 240 lbs. Your size is small or medium (your choice).

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Canine Senses
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Furry Fiend
entries: You have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against Tabaxi.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Brutal Maw
entries: After taking the Attack action to make a melee attack, you can use a bonus action to make an unarmed attack with your teeth. On a hit, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Hunter's Grip
entries: When a creature you have grappled attempts to break free, you can use your reaction to sink your teeth into them and gain advantage on the contested roll.

entries.name: All Fours.
entries: You can take the {@action Dash} action as bonus action, when you do so, you run on all fours.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your connection to the afterlife grants you sight in darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: The Scales
entries: If you are reduced to 0 hitpoints, you can use your reaction to immediately roll a deathsave. On a success, you can expend one hitdie to regain hitpoints and stay conscious. On a failure, you immediately fail one deathsave. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Deductive Intuition
entries: When you make an Intelligence (Investigation) or a Wisdom (Insight) check, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Sniff 'Em Out
entries: You can cast the {@spell detect evil and good|phb} and {@spell detect poison and disease|phb} spells with this trait without providinf material components. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast the {@spell see invisibility|phb} spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Vulpine Slyness
entries: When you make an Dexterity (Stealth) or a Charisma (Deception) check, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Quick Reflexes
entries: When targeted by an attack from a creature you can see, and you are not {@condition incapacitated}, you may use your reaction to give the attack roll disadvantage.
The fenri are a canine like people, usually less aggressive than their gnoll cousins, though not always. Fenri can make excellent companions, but only if they want to.
Just like dogs, fenri come in a wide variety of shapes, sizes and colours.

entries.name: Age
entries: Thalian Cyclopes mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Thalian Cyclopes tend to be neutral, prefering to dedicate to their craft rather than politics or tradition.

entries.name: Size
entries: Thalian Cyclopes are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Thalian Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison and fire damage.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Magic Forgemaster
entries: You can cast the {@spell identify|phb} spell as a ritual. You don't require material components when you cast it using this feature.

entries.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: You have disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
Deep under the mighty volcano of Thalia generations of cyclopes have laboured for thousands of years, producing some of the greatest weapons in the known world, including the thunderbolts of Zeus.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical cannon is between two and three years old. The maximum cannon lifespans remains a mystery; so far, cannons have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most cannons take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law andneutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Cannons stand just over 2 feet tall and average about 20 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common. You can also speak using your Machine Speech trait.

entries.name: Machine Speech
entries: Machine Speech is a series of beeps at varying pitch and length. At the DM's discretion, certain other creatures may understand or speak this language.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to {@condition poison|phb} damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest.
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious|phb}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Natural Armor.
entries: Due to the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor and gain no benefit from wearing it. Your body provides ample protection, however; your base armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Force Ballista.
entries: You know the {@spell Tin's Force Ballista|Jackalope} cantrip.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip when you cast it with this trait (choose when you select this race).
Eldritch Cannons are the living weapons of artificers. Most are simple unthinking machines but, in rare circumstances, a cannon may gain sentience and free will, becoming an Awakened Cannon.
Cannons come in all manner of sizes and shapes, despite this, they are treated as humanoids and are capable of all the actions of typical humanoids.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Poison Susceptibility
entries: Your inability to vomit hinders your ability to handle poisons. You are vulnerable to poison damage and have disadvantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the poison condition.

entries.name: Disease Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove diseases.

entries.name: Hulking Frame
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Intimidation} skills.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Plague Bite
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike you can force that creature to roll a DC12 Constitution saving throw or gain the {@condition poisoned} condition for 1 minute.

entries.name: The Plague
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you must roll a {@dice d20} and consult the table below to determine the effect. The effect lasts until the end of your next long rest, or until it is removed by the {@spell lesser restoration|phb} or {@spell greater restoration|phb} spell.

rows: You have disadvantge on all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on all ability checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Strength checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Dexterity checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Constitution checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Intelligence checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Wisdom checks and saving throws.
You have disadvantge on Charisma checks and saving throws.
When a creature fails the saving throw for your Plague Bite trait, they take an addtional {@dice 1d4} poison damage.
When a creature fails the saving throw for your Plague Bite trait, they take an addtional {@dice 2d4} poison damage.
When a creature fails the saving throw for your Plague Bite trait, they take an addtional {@dice 3d4} poison damage.

entries.name: Rodent Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Lab Training
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

entries.name: Glyph Master
entries: You can spend one minute to read or write up to 25 words in any written language.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature, and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entries.name: Street Smarts
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks when in areas of heavy construction such as towns and dungeons.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Reveler
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion} skills, and you have proficiency with one {@item musical instrument|phb} of your choice.

entries.name: Strong Willed
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened}.

entries.name: Quiet as a mouse
entries: You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.

entries.name: Mouse Nimbleness
entries: You count as one size smaller when determining your ability to squeeze through gaps, mount other creatures or move through the space of other creatures.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Age
entries: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Unlike most halflings, leprechauns are often mischievous and chaotic in nature.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. The Halfling language isn't secret, but halflings are loath to share it with others. They write very little, so they don't have a rich body of literature. Their oral tradition, however, is very strong. Almost all halflings speak Common to converse with the people in whose lands they dwell or through which they are traveling.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Little Cobbler
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item cobbler's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Pot O' Gold
entries: You have access to a personal demiplane in which you can store treasure. As an action you can transfer a tiny, non-magical object, or up to 50 coins, from your hand to the demiplane. The demiplane can hold up to five pounds of non-magical objects (coins do not count towards this limit). While in the demiplane, the contents weigh nothing and can only be retrieved by you as an action. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, the contents spill out into a space within 5ft. of you.

entries.name: Age
entries: Yamatlaca typically mature around 8 years of age. Yamatlaca rarely live beyond 50 years of age.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Yamatlaca often serve as guards for farmers and caravans, tending towards lawful and neutral alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: With their long necks upright, Yamatlaca typically stand just above 7 feet tall. Your size is medium

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Big Eyes, Bigger Ears
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight or hearing.

entries.name: Bold Beasts
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Spit
entries: Your spit is a natural ranged weapon, which you can use to make a ranged attack with a range of 30 feet (long range 60 feet). You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, you choose to deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Dexterity modifier. Alternatively you can forgo the damage of the attack and instead give the target disadvantge on its next attack roll.

entries.name: Thick Wool
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Hiker
entries: Your travel pace over mountain terrain is doubled as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

entries.name: Sunbaked
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Sandwalker
entries: Your travel pace over desert terrain is doubled as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

entries.name: Jungle Scavenger
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Jungle Delver
entries: Your travel pace in jungle terrain is doubled as is the travel pace of up to ten companions while they're within 60 feet of you and you're not {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

These large, courageous humanoids have bestial appearances resembling camelids, such as llamas, alpacas or camels. Their large eyes and ears grant them keen senses which, combined with their natural courage, make them popular as guards for farms and merchant caravans. However, you should never insult a Yamatlaca, else you may learn about their infamous spit the hard way.
Yamatlaca can be found in many climates, from the highest mountains to the hottest deserts and muggist swamp.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Draconic Cry.
entries: As a bonus action, you let out a cry at your enemies within 10 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies have advantage on attack rolls against any of those enemies who could hear you. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Wilderness Legacy
entries: Accustomed to life in the wild, you have adapted to extreme environments. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

items: {@b {@i Cave Dweller.}} The range of your darkvsion increases to 120ft. In addition, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain or dim light.
{@b {@i Cliff Climber.}} You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, you can jump up to your full long jump or high jump distance, even without a running start.
{@b {@i Sea Diver.}} You have a Swimming speed equal to your walking speed and can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Mutant Legacy
entries: You have developed some mutation that separates you from other kobolds. Choose one of the following legacy options for your kobold.

items: {@b {@i Draconic Hide.}} You have resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you select this race); acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant or thunder.

{@b {@i Tiny Target.}} You have a +1 bonus to your armor class. In addition, you count as one size smaller when determining your ability to squeeze through gaps, mount other creatures or move through the space of other creatures.

{@b {@i Vicious Weapons.}} You have sharp teath, claws, horns or tail spikes which you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with it, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier piercing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Looks like a duck
entries: While not wearing armor or holding items, you are virtually indistinguishable from a large duck. A creature can make a DC15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to determine your true nature.

entries.name: Walks like a duck
entries: You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

entries.name: Quacks like a duck
entries: You can communicate simple messages to ducks and other aquatic birds. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

The nature of these people has always confused scholars, even mallardians themselves may not be quite sure what they are and where their people came from. By most metrics they appear to be simple ducks, yet they can walk, talk and fight like other humanoids.

entries.name: Bad Flier
entries: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You fall at the end of a turn if you are airborne and the only thing holding you aloft is your flying speed.

entries.name: Glider
entries: When you are falling, and you are not {@condition incapacitated|phb}, you can use a reaction to slow your rate of descent to 60 feet per round. If you land while using this trait, you take no falling damage.

entries.name: Peck
entries: Your beak is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.
While these feathered beings resemble birds and possess wings, they are terrible fliers. They may have been mighty fliers once, but have found the ability waning over the many generations since.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Climbing does not cost you extra movement. In addition, you have advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock you prone.

entries.name: Wooly Coat
entries: While you have a full coat of wool you have resistance to cold damage, however you also have vulnerability to fire damage and disadvantage on saving throws against extreme heat.
If your coat is sheared over the course of 10 minutes, you lose the effects of this trait (unless you get them from another source) until your wool grows back after {@dice 1d6+1} days

entries.name: Headbutt
entries: You have a thick skull or heavy horns, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

A mountain people with hooves, horns and wooly coats, they are sometimes confused for goats or sheep, often to their annoyance. They frequently be found roaming the mountains and hills in large herds, finding comfort in crowds, though some lone wanderers make their way down from the hills.

entries.name: Fey
entries: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

entries.name: Wild Spirit
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|phb} cantrip.

entries.name: Dryad Magic
entries: You can cast the {@spell animal friendship|phb}, {@spell charm person} and {@spell entangle} spells with this trait and without material components. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

Dryads are the spirits of trees manifested in near humanoid form, typically with a feminine appearance. They are often found has protectors of woodland areas, overseeing the trees and beasts and protecting them from encroaching wildfires, hunters and deforestation.
In Cyranos in Alvergia, they are often found in tribes led by a queen and are known to mingle with tribes of satyrs, centaurs and wood elves.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Slimy
entries: You have advantage on rolls to avoid or escape the {@condition grappled|phb} condition.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: Whenever you roll a hit die to regain hit points, you may add your proficiency bonus to the result of each roll. In addition, during a long rest, you can regrow any non-vital organs or limbs you have lost, such as arms, legs or eyes.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.
In the jungles and swamps of the world, many forms of life exist that can seem strange or alien to outsiders. This includes the Urodels, an amphibious and slimy people resembling large salamanders.
Also refered to as Axoes or Salamans, the Urodels are extraordinarily resilient thanks to their natural regeneration abilities, even regrowing entire limbs in a matter of hours.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this race.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Mineral Body
entries: You do not need to breathe, eat or drink.

entries.name: Crystalline Flesh
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Diamond Mind
entries: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition charmed|phb} and {@condition frightened|phb} conditions.

entries.name: Jewelled Hide
entries: As an action, you can grow a layer of resilient crystals over your skin for 1 minute, or until you are {@condition incapacitated|phb}. For this duration, you gain temporary hit points equal to three times your proficiency bonus. While you have these temporary hit points, you have immunity to psychic damage, and if a creature hits you with a melee attack, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items: {@b {@i Fingers of Quartz.}} When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into shards of crystal. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier psychic damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
{@b {@i Heart of Ruby.}} You know the {@spell mind sliver|tce} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).
{@b {@i Jewel Affinity.}} You have proficiency with {@item jeweler's tools|phb} and advantage on checks made using them.

entries.name: Frozen Flesh
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Glacial Walker
entries: Slippery ice and deep snow do not count as {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for you, and you automatically pass saving throws to avoid failing prone on slippery ice. In addition, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in icy or snowy terrain.

entries.name: Arctic Hide
entries: As an action, you can grow a layer of hardened ice over your skin for 1 minute, or until you are {@condition incapacitated|phb}. For this duration, you gain temporary hit points equal to three times your proficiency bonus. While you have these temporary hit points, you have immunity to cold damage, and if a creature hits you with a melee attack, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} cold damage.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items: {@b {@i Fingers of Frost.}} When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into icicles. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier cold damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
{@b {@i Heart of Ice.}} You know the {@spell frostbite|xge} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).
{@b {@i Ice Skater.}} By briefly freezing the ground at your feet, you can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground.

entries.name: Scorched Flesh
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Mantle Swimmer
entries: Lava and magma pose no threat to you. You take no damage from it, and have a swim speed equal to your walking speed while submerged in it. In addition, while you are completely submerged in lava or magma, you are effectively {@condition invisible|phb}.

entries.name: Geothermal Hide
entries: As an action, you can grow a layer of magma over your skin for 1 minute, or until you are {@condition incapacitated|phb}. For this duration, you gain temporary hit points equal to three times your proficiency bonus. While you have these temporary hit points, you have immunity to fire damage, and if a creature hits you with a melee attack, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} fire damage.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Gaian Manifestation
entries: Your connection to your source can manifest in different ways in an individual gaian. Choose one of the following manifestation options for your gaian.

items: {@b {@i Fingers of Flame.}} When you make an unarmed strike, you can transform your fingers or hands into tendrils of lava and flame. When you hit with them, the strike deals {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier fire damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
{@b {@i Heart of Fire.}} You know the {@spell produce flame|phb} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for this cantrip is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this race).
