{@b {@i Burning Blood.}} At the end of a long rest, you can produce a number of flasks of {@item alchemist's fire (flask)|phb|alchemist's fire} equal to your proficiency bonus. These flasks last until they are used or until the end of your next long rest.

entries: Gaians are beings awakened from the natural minerals of the world itself. Despite being composed of typically nonliving matter, these people are very much conscious, living beings in their own right.

Gaians are usually awakened fully mature and alone with no families of their own, save the bonds they make with other creatures. As such, they usually adopt the languages and cultures of those they interact with after being awakened. No one is quite sure how they are awakened, though many suspect the whims of gods or nature spirits are often involved.

No lifespan limit is known for gaians and they show no physical signs of aging. However they can still be wearied by time and those who do not fall to injury or disease will sometimes willingly return their source when they feel their time is up.

spell.name: Time Stasis
entries: This spell lets you freeze a creature or object in time. Choose a creature, of size Large or smaller, or a non-magical object, that is not greater than 10ft in any dimension, that you can see within range. If the target is a creature or is an object carried or worn by a creature, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be frozen in time for the spell's duration.
While frozen, a target is {@condition incapacitated|phb}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings. It is also unaffected by any external forces such as gravity, attacks and spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can affect one additional creature or object for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Tin's Force Ballista
entries: You fire a small dart of magically compressed matter at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} force damage. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet in a straight line away from you.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Boomerang Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You launch the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a ranged attack with it against a creature you can see within 30 feet of you, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and takes an additional {@dice 1d4} force damage. Hit or miss the weapon then returns to your hand.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Reverse Teleport
entries: You choose a creature you are familiar with. If the creature is willing, is on the same plane of existence as you and is not {@condition incapacitated}, they are then instantly transported to a space within 10 feet of you.
The creature instinctively understands that the spell will transport them and recognizes you as the caster if it knows you but it does not know where it will transported to.

spell.name: Arcane Mirror
entries: You create a magic, spectral mirror, that is no larger than 5 feet in any dimension, at a point you can see within range. Whenever a spell, that is cast in a line, hits the mirror, it is reflected at an angle of your choice for the remainder of its range and the mirror is destroyed. If this would result in a creature or object being hit by the spell multiple times, they are subjected to the effects of the spell for each time.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use a bonus action to move the mirror up to 30 feet in any direction. If the mirror is ever more than 30 feet from you, it is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can create two mirrors simultaneously and move them both independently with the same bonus action. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can create and control up to three mirrors simultaneously.

spell.name: Bazoz's Spicy Water
entries: You choose a volume of liquid that is primarily water, that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. The liquid may be separated into multiple groups or containers, provided they still fit within the 5-foot cube. You produce up to three of the following effects in the liquid for the spell's duration.

items: You fill the liquid with faintly glowing bubbles. You choose the color, size and density of these bubbles.
You make the liquid move in a simple repeating pattern, such as a small whirlpool, fountain or convection current. This movement is not strong enough to move or harm creatures or objects.
You make the liquid slowly change color or opacity every few seconds. In addition, you can make the liquid glow, producing dim light within 10ft.

You give the liquid a smell, flavor and temperature of your choice. The temperature change cannot be so great that the liquid would boil, freeze, or be directly harmful to creatures it wasn't previously.
You increase or decrease the potency of any non-magical substances in the liquid, such as alcohol or caffeine. You cannot alter the effects of poisons or potions in this way.
You alter the buoyancy of tiny objects or creatures in the liquid. This effect cannot move an unwilling creature or alter a creature's movement speed in the liquid.

entries: You may also suggest additional effects if your DM allows. None of the effects may directly harm or move creatures. You can dispel any of the effects you created at any point (no action required).
The maximum duration of this spell increases up to 24 hours when you reach 5th level, up to 7 days at 11th level, and up to 1 year at 17th level.

spell.name: Greater Ceremony

components.m: 500 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: You perform a special religious ceremony that is infused with magic. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.
{@b Communion.} You touch one humanoid who wishes to speak directly to your god. They can cast the {@spell commune|phb} spell once as a ritual and without providing material components.

{@b Last Will and Testament.} You touch a humanoid that wishes to leave possessions with another when they die. The target names a creature they are familiar with to be their heir. When the target dies, their body, along with any items they are wearing or carrying, are transported magically to a space within 5ft of the heir, even across planes. If the heir themselves is dead, the items do not teleport. A target can gain this rite again to change their designated heir, they may only have one heir at a time. The target loses this rite when they die.

{@b Oath of Friendship.} You touch two humanoids who wish to never harm one another. These targets are permanently {@condition charmed} by each other (even if they are otherwise immune to the charmed condition) and cannot perform any action that would directly harm the other, even if compelled to do so by any means short of a {@spell wish|phb} spell. A target can only benefit from this rite once and loses it if either of the targets dies.

{@b Procreation.} You touch adult humanoids who wish to have a child together, regardless of their number, their fertility or the combination of their races and sexes. One of the targets becomes pregnant. Alternatively, an egg or artificial womb is created externally within 10 feet of you. After an appropriate amount of time (or {@dice 2d6+2} months), a child is born or hatches. The race and statistics of the child are decided by the DM. A target can only benefit from this rite again after the child is born, hatched or dies.
{@b Purity Ward.} You touch one humanoid that wishes to remain pure. The target is immune to disease, immune to lycanthropy and can't become undead by any means short of a {@spell wish|phb} spell.

{@b Standing Vigil.} You touch one humanoid who wishes to protect a particular creature, location or object. While they are within 30ft of the subject of their protection, they do not need to eat, drink or sleep and when they take a long rest, they appear inert and motionless but are not rendered {@condition unconscious|phb}, and they can see and hear as normal. A creature can benefit from this rite only once and loses the rite if the subject of their protection dies or is destroyed.

{@b Transition.} You touch one humanoid that wishes to permanently change their age, appearance, race or sex. The target describes what they wish to be and, if the DM allows, they are then transformed. If the target changes race, they take on the racial traits and ability score improvements of their new race and discard the ones of their previous race. If the target's current form is the result of a curse or other magic effect, this rite has no effect until the curse or effect is removed. A creature can only benefit from this rite once.

{@b Undying Devotion.} You touch a target who wishes to serve your god, even after death. If a spell, such as {@spell raise dead|phb}, has the sole effect of restoring them to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on them. A creature can benefit from this rite only once and loses the rite once it is used.

spell.name: Spectral Crew

components.m: a piece of debris from a shipwreck

entries: You touch a non-magical ship and summon up to 10 spectral sailors to crew it for the spell's duration. These spectral sailors do not fight or perform any actions not directly related to crewing the ship, but they are added to the crew numbers of the ship for the purposes of determining possible ship actions and will obey a captain's orders. This spell ends early if you are ever more than 100ft from the ship.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you summon up to 10 additional sailors for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Impotence
entries: Choose one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, force, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with chosen damage type until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Ray of Lumbering
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Dexterity until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Rising Words
entries: You target a creature in range and utter a phrase or joke so abhorrent to the creature that you awaken a furious anger inside them. The targeted creature can immediately use a reaction (even if they are {@condition unconscious}) to move up to its movement speed toward you, without provoking opportunity attacks, before making an unarmed strike against you.

The target can choose to use your spellcasting ability modifier in place of its Strength modifier for the attack roll and damage. On a hit, you suffer the attack's normal effects and the creature regains hit points equal to twice the damage dealt.
If the targeted creature is {@condition unconscious} and does not hit you with an attack, or still has 0 hit points after the attack, it remains {@condition unconscious} once the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of hit points regained by the creature on a hit increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Runner's Rope
entries: You fire a magical dart at an object you can see within range that is Huge or larger, or that is fixed in place (such as a wall or ceiling). The dart remains fixed to the target for the spell's duration, and a 30ft long magic rope extends from the dart to your empty hand. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks you make using the rope.
When you cast the spell, or as a subsequent bonus action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can touch the rope and perform one of the following actions:

items: {@b {@i Reel In.}} You reduce the length of the rope by up to 30ft. Any creatures grasping the rope are moved towards the dart by a number of feet equal to the number you reduce the rope by, following the path of the rope. A creature that is not {@condition restrained} by the rope can let go of the rope at any point during this movement to stop moving.
{@b {@i Reel Out.}} You extend the length of the rope by up to 30ft (to a maximum of 100ft).
{@b {@i Reshoot.}} The dart and rope vanish, and you fire a new dart at a new target within range.

spell.name: Chain Blade

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You touch the weapon used in the spell's casting and chains extend from your wrist to the weapon. Until the start of your next turn, that weapon's reach is 5 feet greater than normal.

spell.name: Caustic Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell's duration, your weapon emits a burst of caustic acid, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} acid damage to the target. Each creature other than you that is within 5 feet of the target (including the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 1d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both the initial damage and the damage dealt to creatures within 5 feet increase by {@dice 1d6} each for every two slot levels above 1st.

subclassFeature.name: Time Domain
entries: The forces of time and entropy are some of the most powerful in the universe. Eventually time will consume everything, even the universe itself. The gods and goddesses who control the flow of time, such as Kronos or Talitus control the lives, deaths and fate of every being in existence. Followers of these deities can employ chronomancy to alter their fate and that of their allies.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Time Domain Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell gift of alacrity|egw}, {@spell feather fall|phb}
3rd
{@spell immovable object|egw}, {@spell hold person|phb}
5th
{@spell slow|phb}, {@spell haste|phb}
7th
{@spell dimension door|phb}, {@spell freedom of movement|phb}*
9th
{@spell far step|xge}, {@spell temporal shunt|egw}

entries: {@note *If your DM allows, you can replace either the {@spell dimension door|phb} or {@spell freedom of movement|phb} spell in your time domain spells with the {@spell Time Stasis|Jackalope} spell.}

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Control
entries: Starting when you choose this domain at 1st level, you have advantage on your initiative rolls, provided you are not {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Rewrite History
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to rewrite a single moment in time.

When you or a creature you can see within 30ft of you rolls damage or healing, you can use your channel divinity as a reaction to force them to reroll a number of dice up to up to your Wisdom modifier, they must then take the result of the new rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Quickened Evasion
entries: At 6th level, you can control the flow of time to improve evasive capabilities for you or your allies. When you or a creature within 30ft of you is targeted by an attack roll or makes a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your wisdom modifier to the creatures AC or saving throw. You can choose to use this feature after the die is rolled, but before the outcome is determined.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any {@class cleric|phb} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Strikes
entries: {@i 8th-level cleric {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Potent Spellcasting feature}

You are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal {@dice 1d8} radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Halt
entries: At 17th level, you learn the {@spell Time Stop} spell as a cleric spell and always have it prepared, it does not count towards your prepared spells. When you cast it as a cleric spell you can target one additional creature to be unaffected by the spell, allowing them to also use actions and move as normal for the duration of the spell. The spell ends for both of you if either of you perform any action that would end the spell for you, as described in the spells description.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Rule: Additional Domain Spells
entries: If your DM allows, you may add the {@spell Reality Break|egw} and {@spell Time Ravage|egw} spells to your cleric spell list.

subclassFeature.name: The Darkweaver
entries: Your patron is a powerful spider-like being from the depths of the Underdark. You serve the whims of an aranea, chwidencha, drider, gee'aantu, giant spider or even figures such as Arachne or Lolth.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Darkweaver lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Darkweaver Expanded Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell sleep|phb}, {@spell snare|xge}
2nd
{@spell find steed|phb} (large or medium {@creature giant wolf spider} only), {@spell web|phb}
3rd
{@spell spirit guardians|phb} (appear as spiders), {@spell stinking cloud|phb}
4th
{@spell giant insect|phb}, {@spell phantasmal killer|phb}
5th
{@spell contagion|phb}, {@spell insect plague|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Nest Crawler
entries: At 1st level, you are acclimated to underground spider nests, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you ignore movement restrictions caused by webbing.

Additionally, you have darkvision out to a range of 120 feet. In that radius, you can see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

subclassFeature.name: Silk Spinner
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can use an action to produce webbing that takes the form of an item you choose from the following list; a {@item net|phb}, a {@item sack|phb}, {@item silk rope (50 feet)|phb}, a {@item sling|phb}, or a {@item whip|phb}. If your DM allows, you may also create any other non-magical item that could believably be made using spider webs. You are proficient with any weapons produced using this feature.

The maximum number of items you can produce with this feature at one time is equal to your proficiency bonus. If you try to exceed your maximum, the oldest item disintegrates, and then the new item is produced.

subclassFeature.name: Toxin Tolerance
entries: At 6th level, you gain resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition poisoned} condition.
When you reach 14th level in this class, you gain immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

subclassFeature.name: Webslinger
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use a bonus action to fire a web to move objects and creatures. Choose an object or creature you can see within 30ft and choose one of the following effects.

items: {@b Pull.} You pull the target up to 15ft towards you. The target must be an object or creature that is large or smaller and is not fixed in place (such as a wall or tree). If you target a creature, or an object worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a Strength saving throw against your warlock spell save DC to avoid this effect.

{@b Trip.} You pull the target {@condition prone.} The target must be a creature that is large or smaller. The creature can make a Strength saving throw against your warlock spell save DC to avoid this effect.

{@b Zip.} You pull yourself up to 15ft towards the target. The target must be an object or creature that is medium or larger or is fixed in place (such as a wall or tree). You also cannot use this effect if you are {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}. If you target a creature, or an object worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC to avoid this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Quickweb
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you see a creature within 30ft (including yourself) take damage, you can use the Pull or Zip effect from your Webslinger feature as a reaction to attempt to move them, potentially having them avoid the damage. You can use the feature in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spider Bites
entries: Starting at 10th level, once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon or warlock cantrip, you can choose to apply one of the following additional effects.

items: {@b Terrifying Horde.} You summon a horde of spectral spiders to swarm over the creature. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt the saving throw again, removing the condition on a success.

{@b Toxic Venom.} You deliver a potent venom through the attack. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can attempt the saving throw again, removing the condition on a success.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Toxin Tolerance Improved
entries: At 14th level, you gain immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Wall Walker
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can cast the {@spell spider climb|phb} spell at will, and without consuming a spell slot. When you do so, you can cast it on up to ten willing creatures, and you automatically pass saving throws to maintain concentration on this spell.

subclassFeature.name: The Hivemind
entries: Your patron is not a single entity but a potentially infinite collective of beings across all the planes of reality. These beings pool their power and knowledge into the collective hivemind. Followers of these hiveminds are granted limited access to the collective knowledge of all its beings but still usually retain their own identity and personality.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Hivemind lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Hivemind Expanded Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell faerie fire|phb}, {@spell identify|phb}
2nd
{@spell detect thoughts|phb}, {@spell locate object|phb}
3rd
{@spell sending|phb}, {@spell clairvoyance|phb}
4th
{@spell locate creature|phb}, {@spell divination|phb}
5th
{@spell legend lore|phb}, {@spell rary's telepathic bond|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Knowledge of the Hive
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you roll for an ability check that uses either your Intelligence or Wisdom modifier, you can call upon the hivemind to gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Network Insight
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can employ the hivemind's drones, senses and memories to find potentially useful tidbits about a creature that may aid you in dealing with them. If you spend 1 minute observing a creature, you can then learn up to two tidbits about the creature. Describe the information you wish to learn, and the DM will decide if you successfully discover this information and what it is (some examples can be seen in the list below). The DM also decides how the information can affect your rolls and gameplay, granting advantage on social checks when using the information would be an appropriate example.

If the creature is disguised, whether by magical or non-magical means, and you are unaware, the DM may decide you learn the characteristics of the persona the creature is presenting rather than their own. Alternatively, they may decide that the hivemind can see through the disguise even if you can't.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it on the same creature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Example Tidbits
items: One ability score of your choice.
Their creature type and race, if any.
Their alignment, if any.
An identifying piece of information, such as a name, rank or title.
A piece of information that can be used to falsify a common bond, such as the name of their hometown, a school they attended or a distant family member.
A secret that could potentially be used to blackmail them, such as an extramarital affair, illicit vice or embarrassing hobby.
An address which they visit frequently, such as their home, workplace or favourite tavern.
Their opinion about a particular person, faction or thing.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Magic
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can attempt to cast a spell or cantrip that you don't know. The spell must be 5th level or lower from the warlock spell list, and you must make a Charisma check or the casting fails. The DC for this check equals 12 + the spell's level (DC12 for a cantrip). If the spell is 1st-level or higher, you expend a warlock spell slot, even if the casting fails.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Ritual
entries: {@note Optional feature that replaces the Hive Magic feature}

Starting at 10th level, when you finish a short or long rest, you can choose a spell of 5th level or lower from the Divination school of magic that has the ritual tag. This spell can be from any spell list, but counts as a warlock spell for you. Until the end of your next short or long rest, you can cast this spell as a ritual.

subclassFeature.name: Psychometry
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can spend ten minutes to touch an object or willing creature and witness a scene from the past that it was present for. The scene must have lasted less than ten minutes and have taken place within 30ft of the target during the time of the scene. Describe the time, place or part of the scene you wish to witness, such as "Yesterday at noon" or "When this window was broken". You then witness the scene over the ten minutes. While doing so, you are {@condition blinded|phb} and {@condition deafened|phb}. The scene ends early if you take damage, or become {@condition incapacitated|phb}.

If the target is a creature, you may witness the event using their senses at the time (you can also do this for a corpse that was alive at the time of the scene). If the target is an object, what you witness is limited, you could hear parts of a conversation, see vague images or sense strong emotions. If a creature, object or area in the scene is hidden from divination magic (or was during the time of the scene), you cannot perceive it or anything inside it but may see other elements of the scene. Once you use this feature, you can not do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Timeless One
entries: Your patron does not conform to the normal flow of time, they may even exist outside of time entirely. Followers of a timeless being can manipulate their own flow of time relative to the world around them, allowing them to move, act and even age at different rates.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Timeless One lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Timeless One Expanded Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell Gift of Alacrity|egw}, {@spell Shield|phb}
2nd
{@spell Blur|phb}, {@spell Magic Weapon|phb}
3rd
{@spell Haste|phb}, {@spell Pulse Wave|egw}
4th
{@spell Gravity Sinkhole|egw}, {@spell Freedom of Movement|phb}
5th
{@spell Destructive Wave|phb}, {@spell Temporal Shunt|egw}

subclassFeature.name: Timeless Warrior
entries: At 1st level, you acquire the training necessary to effectively arm yourself for battle. You gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Rush
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can enter a slightly different time stream to those around you, thereby improving your relative speed and reflexes. As a bonus action, you can trigger a rush provided you are not {@condition incapacitated} or wearing heavy armor. The rush lasts 1 minute but ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or choose to end it (no action required). For the duration of the rush, your speed is increased by 10ft and you have advantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws.
Additionally, whenever you trigger a rush, you choose one of the following forms, each form grants you additional benefits for the duration of the rush.

items: {@b Dancer.} You can use a bonus action to take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Dodge} action. You may also use this bonus action as part of the same one you use to trigger the rush.
{@b Strider.} {@quickref Difficult terrain||3} does not slow you down.
{@b Striker.} You can use a bonus action to gain advantage on your next attack roll within the same rush. You may also use this bonus action as part of the same one you use to trigger the rush.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
When you reach 10th level in this class, each of your rush forms gain extra benefits.

subclassFeature.name: Dj Vu
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can briefly jump back in time a few seconds to act simultaneously with your past self. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Delay Spell
entries: Starting at 10th level, when a spell that targets an area you can see, such as the {@spell fireball|phb} spell, you may use a reaction to freeze the spell in time for a short duration. The spell is still cast in the same area but will not take effect until you release it any point before the end of your next turn (no action required), potentially allowing creatures and objects to enter or leave the area before the spell is released. The spell is released early if you lose sight of the spell's area, if you are {@condition incapacitated|phb}, or you die. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Rush
entries: At 10th level, each of your rush forms gain additional benefits for the duration of the rush.

items: {@b Dancer.} You can take a reaction on every turn in combat.
{@b Strider.} You gain a climbing speed and a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
{@b Striker.} Your attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or higher on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Timeless Body
entries: Starting at 14th level, you no longer age unless you choose to, and you can't be aged magically. Additionally, you no longer need to breathe, eat, drink or sleep.

subclassFeature.name: The Dragon
entries: Dragons are among the most powerful beings on the material plane and sometimes beyond. The strongest dragons may take on mortal followers and grant them a share of their power.
Choose your patrons dragon form or determine it randomly, using the Dragon Form table below.

entries.caption: Dragon Form
rows: Chromatic
Black Dragon, Blue Dragon, Dragon Turtle, Green Dragon, Red Dragon, Tiamat or White Dragon
Metallic
Bahamut, Brass Dragon, Bronze Dragon, Copper Dragon or Gold Dragon
Gem
Amethyst Dragon, Crystal Dragon, Emerald Dragon, Moonstone Dragon, Sapphire Dragon, Sardior or Topaz Dragon

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Dragon lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The Dragon Expanded Spells table shows the dragon spells that are added to the warlock spell list for you, along with the spells associated in the table with your patrons dragon form: chromatic, metallic or gem.

entries.caption: Dragon Expanded Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell Absorb Elements|xge}
{@spell Chromatic Orb|phb}
{@spell Cure Wounds|phb}
{@spell Command|phb}
2nd
{@spell Dragon's Breath|xge}
{@spell Scorching Ray|phb}
{@spell Lesser Restoration|phb}
{@spell Calm Emotions|phb}
3rd
{@spell Lightning Bolt|phb}
{@spell Fireball|phb}
{@spell Protection from Energy|phb}
{@spell Sending|phb}
4th
{@spell Fire Shield|phb}
{@spell Ice Storm|phb}
{@spell Aura of Life|phb}
{@spell Phantasmal Killer|phb}
5th
{@spell Summon Draconic Spirit|ftd}
{@spell Cone of Cold|phb}
{@spell Greater Restoration|phb}
{@spell Telekinesis|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Affinity
entries: At 1st level, choose one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You have resistance to this damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Chaotic Affinity
entries: {@note Optional Feature which replaces Draconic Affinity}
Starting at 1st level, whenever you finish a short or long rest, roll a d10 and consult the table below. You have resistance to this damage type until the end of your next short or long rest.

rows: acid
cold
fire
force
lightning
necrotic
poison
psychic
radiant
thunder

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Head
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can use a bonus action to summon a spectral dragon head above or next to your own. The head remains for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it (no action required), after which it vanishes. The head vanishes early if you are incapacitated or you die.

When you create the head, you can use it in one of the ways in the Dragon Head Actions list below. Until the head vanishes, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to use the head in one of these ways again.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Dragon Head Actions
items: {@bold Bite.} You use the head to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5ft of you. On a hit, the target takes piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + plus your Charisma modifier. This attack counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

{@bold Breath.} You use the head to exhale destructive energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC, taking {@dice 2d6} damage of the type associated with your Draconic Affinity (or Chaotic Affinity) feature on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@bold Grasp.} You use the head to take the {@action Grapple} action against a creature within 10 feet of you. You may use your warlock spell attack modifier in place of your Strength (Athletics) for the contested rolls. You do not require a free hand to grapple a creature in this way and the creature is released if the head vanishes. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you cannot use the head for any other actions, except to release the creature (no action required).
{@bold Preparation.} You prepare the head for upcoming events. You gain one additional reaction until the start of your next turn. You may only take one reaction on each turn in combat.

{@bold Darksight.} You use the head to gain darkvision out to 60ft and gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks until the start of your next turn. In addition, you can see through magical darkness while using this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Reflex
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you, or a creature you see within 15ft of you, takes damage of the type associated with your Draconic Affinity (or Chaotic Affinity) feature, you can use a reaction in one of the following ways based on your patrons dragon form:

items: {@bold Chromatic.} The creature takes an additional {@dice 1d6} damage of the same type. When you reach 10th level in this class, the damage increases to {@dice 2d6}.
{@bold Metallic.} The damage taken by the creature is reduced by {@dice 1d8}. When you reach 10th level in this class, the damage reduced increases to {@dice 2d8}.

{@bold Gem.} The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a fail, they are {@condition frightened} by the source of the damage until the end of its next turn. When you reach 10th level in this class, the {@condition frightened} condition lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Scaled Wings
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can use an action to unfurl a pair of draconic wings and gain a flying speed of 60ft for 10 minutes. You can use this action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Shape
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can cast the {@spell polymorph|phb} spell on yourself without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell using this feature, you chose the form of a {@filter dragon whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&14]|type=dragon}, rather than a beast. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Feast Domain
entries: Food is about more than just sustenance. The act of gathering around the fire or table to share food and stories brings communities together and forms a bond greater than the sum of its parts.
Deities of the Feast could include, but are not limited to; Dagda, Dionysus, Olga and Demeter.

entries.caption: Feast Domain Spells
rows: 1st
{@spell goodberry|phb}, {@spell purify food and drink|phb}
3rd
{@spell calm emotions|phb}, {@spell protection from poison|phb}
5th
{@spell create food and water|phb}, {@spell motivational speech|ai}
7th
{@spell aura of purity|phb}, {@spell fabricate|phb}
9th
{@spell greater restoration|phb}, {@spell rary's telepathic bond|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Gracious Host
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with {@item brewer's supplies|phb} and {@item cook's utensils|phb}.

Additionally, you know the {@spell prestidigitation|phb} and {@spell produce flame|phb} cantrips. These count as cleric cantrips for you, but they dont count against the number of cleric cantrips you know.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Halls of Merriment
entries: As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to fill the area around you with the sounds and smells of a joyous feast for 1 minute. Once on each of your turns for the duration, you can choose a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus that you can see within 30ft of you to become intoxicated with the cheerful atmosphere of the feast. Until the start of your next turn, these creatures have advantage on any Charisma checks and saving throws they make, but have disadvantage on any Wisdom checks and saving throws they make.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Storing Snacks
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can produce a special snack or drink that is infused with magic. With {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, {@item cook's utensils|phb} or your {@item holy symbol|phb} in hand, you can produce a snack over the course of 10 minutes and store a single spell in it by expending a spell slot of a high enough level and providing any material components. The spell must be a cleric spell between 1st and 5th level that you have prepared, it must have a casting time of either 1 action or 1 bonus action and must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. The snack lasts until it is consumed or until the end of your next long rest.

When a creature consumes the snack as an action, the spell is cast with them as the target. The spell uses your spellcasting ability. If the spell normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any {@class cleric|phb} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Strikes
entries: {@i 8th-level cleric {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}, which replaces the Potent Spellcasting feature}

You are blessed with divine might in battle. When a creature takes damage from one of your cantrips or weapon attacks, you can also deal {@dice 1d8} radiant damage to that creature. Once you deal this damage, you can't use this feature again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Gourmet Snacks
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you roll for damage or healing on a spell cast using your Spell Storing Snacks feature, you can instead choose to deal maximum damage or healing, instead of rolling. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Experimenter
entries: Experimentation is a critical part of arcane research, most prefer to take a more cautious approach, rarely venturing beyond their own capabilities. You however prefer to push as far as you can go just to see what happens. This means the artifice you produce can be very powerful but is chaotic and difficult to control, even you don't fully understand it.

subclassFeature.name: Experimenter Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Experimenter Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Experimenter Spells
rows: 3rd Level
{@spell chaos bolt|xge}, {@spell jim's magic missile |ai}
5th Level
{@spell nathair's mischief|ftd}, {@spell pyrotechnics|xge}
9th Level
{@spell blink|phb}, {@spell hypnotic pattern|phb}
13th Level
{@spell confusion|phb}, {@spell polymorph|phb}
17th Level
{@spell animate objects|phb}, {@spell destructive wave|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Additional Infusion
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can infuse one additional item at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Artifice
entries: Starting at 3rd level, whenever you expend an artificer spell slot, the DM may have you roll a d20. If you roll a 1, you trigger a chaos effect and must roll on the chaos effects table below. When you trigger a chaos effect, you cannot do so again until the current one ends.
If a chaos effect is a spell that normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

entries.caption: Chaos Effects
rows: Each of your infused items becomes non-magical and loses any benefits granted by the infusion. This lasts 1 minute, after which the items regain the benefits of the infusion.

Each of your infused items lets out a horrifying scream. Any creatures within 5ft of an infused item must make a Wisdom saving throw against your artificer spell save DC or be {@condition frightened} of the item until the end of your next turn.

Each of your infused items lets out a toxic vapor. Any creatures within 5ft of an infused item must make a Constitution saving throw against your artificer spell save DC or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items is instantly transported 30ft in a random direction, including up or down. If they arrive in a space already occupied by an object or a creature, they take {@dice 2d6} force damage and are transported back to their original space.

Each of your infused items emits a harmless but foul smelling smoke or fluid of a random color for 1 minute. Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items has disadvantage on any ability check to interact socially for this duration.

Each of your infused items begin emitting dramatic music for 10 minutes. For the duration, any creatures that are wearing or carrying at least one of your infusions have advantage on Charisma checks, but also have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Each of your infused items begin to produce a dense fog in the surrounding area for 1 minute. For the duration, the area in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on the item is heavily obscured. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) can disperse the fog until the end of your next turn, after which the area becomes obscured again.

Each of your infused items deposits burning coals next to it as casts the {@spell create bonfire|xge} cantrip in a random space adjacent to it. This casting uses your character level and artificer spell save DC.

Each of your infused items begin producing colorful bubbles for 10 minutes. For the duration, any creatures that are wearing or carrying at least one of your infusions rise vertically 5 feet on each of their turns, as if under the effect of the {@spell levitate|phb} spell.

Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items must roll a {@dice d2}. On a 1, they shrink for 1 minute, as if affected by the Reduce effect of the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell. On a 2, they grow for 1 minute, as if affected by the Enlarge effect of the same spell.
Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items grows an additional eye that grants them blindsight out to 15ft for 1 minute.
Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items becomes {@condition invisible} for 1 minute, or until they make an attack or cast a spell.
Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items can immediately use their reaction to move up to their full movement without provoking opportunity attacks.
Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items is gains {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points for each item they wear or carry as the items start humming a calming melody.

Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items is joined by a random {@filter tiny beast of CR 0|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0]|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm|size=t}, such as a {@creature cat|mm} or {@creature hare|IDRotF}. The creature and the beast are both {@condition charmed} by each other. The beast obeys the creature's commands and acts on their turn. This lasts for one hour, until the beast dies or if it's ever more than 30ft away from the creature, after which the beast disappears into mist.

If a creature uses one of your infused items to make a weapon attack in the next minute, they can roll one additional damage die when determining the damage of the attack as the weapon grows an extra blade, head or round.
If a creature uses one of your infused items as a spellcasting focus to cast a spell in the next minute, they gain a bonus to one of the spell's damage or healing rolls equal to {@dice 1d8}.
If a creature uses one of your infused items as armor, or a shield, and is hit by an attack in the next minute, the attacker takes {@dice 1d6} force damage as the item counterattacks.

Once on each of your turns for the next minute, you can choose one of your infused items to shoot a spark of lightning at a creature of your choice within 15ft of it (no action required). The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your artificer spell save DC or take {@dice 2d6} lightning damage.
Each creature that is wearing or carrying at least one of your infused items regains an expended spell slot of 3rd-level or lower (the creature's choice).

subclassFeature.name: Radiation Burst
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can use an action can broadcast a wave of energy that may help or hinder those nearby. Roll a number of d8s equal to your proficiency bonus, the effect is determined by whether you rolled an even or an odd total on the dice:

items: {@bold Soothing (Even).} Any creatures within 15ft of you gain temporary hit points equal to the result of the roll. You may choose a number of creatures up to your proficiency bonus to be excluded from this effect.

{@bold Withering (Odd).} Any creatures within 15ft of you must make a Constitution saving throw against your artificer spell save DC. Each creature takes force damage equal to the result of the roll on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You may choose a number of creatures up to your proficiency bonus to be excluded from this effect.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Marginal Control
entries: Starting at 9th level, whenever you roll a d20 for your Experimental Artifice feature, you may roll 2 d20s and choose which result to use.

subclassFeature.name: Unbalanced Inspiration
entries: Starting at 9th level, when you roll for an ability check or attack roll, you can utilise your chaotic artifice to gain advantage on the roll. Until the start of your next turn, you have disadvantage on all saving throws.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dubious Reserves
entries: Starting at 15th, you can use an action to touch a magical item that has expended charges, and have it instantly regain {@dice 1d6-1} charges. To use this feature, the item must be capable of regaining charges daily.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend an artificer spell slot of 3rd level or higher. Expending a spell slot in this way automatically triggers a chaos effect as described in your Experimental Artifice feature.

subclassFeature.name: Vermin
entries: The smaller beasts of of the world are often overlooked, or even despised, but not by you. You see the value in these creatures and thus have sought to befriend them. In return, they make resourceful allies.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Kin
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill if you don't already have it.
Additionally, you can cast the {@spell animal messenger|phb} and {@spell speak with animals|phb} spells as rituals.

subclassFeature.name: Vermin Friend
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell as a ritual and without proving material components. When you do so using this feature, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses as long as you are within 300ft of them.

When the familiar takes damage while within 300ft of you, you can use your reaction to temporarily dismiss them to a pocket dimension without taking the damage. You can then use an action to make them reappear as described in the spell's description.
Your familiar's proficiency bonus is equal to yours. The familiar also gains the benefits of any feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

Your familiar is proficient with {@item thieves' tools|phb} and {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, and can use them even if its form normally couldn't. At the DM's discretion, they may also use other tiny items such as keys, quills or vials of poison.

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one of your own attacks to allow your familiar to use their reaction to make one attack of their own. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack feature if it uses a natural weapon (such as Bite or Talons), or a finesse or ranged weapon. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply.

subclassFeature.name: Critter Horde
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can cast the {@spell conjure animals|phb} spell at 3rd-level without expending a spell slot. When you do so using this feature, you summon {@filter swarms of tiny beasts|bestiary|type=beast|tag=swarm|miscellaneous=} instead of beasts.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Extraction
entries: Starting at 13th level, your vermin friend can touch a non-magical object, that weighs 10lbs or fewer, and use an action to teleport it instantly to your open hand. The object can not be one that is worn or carried by a creature other than the familiar, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. The familiar can also teleport itself to a space within 5ft of you as part of the same action along with any items it is wearing or carrying.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Critter Horde
entries: Starting at 17th level, when you cast {@spell conjure animals|phb} using your Critter Horde feature, you can cast it at 5th-level rather than 3rd-level.

vehicle.name: Rowboat

entries: 15 ft.
Move up to its speed, with one 90-degree turn. Without oars, the rowboat's speed is 0.

action: On its turn, the rowboat can take the move action below. It can't take this action if it has no crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The rowboat can move using its oars.

vehicle.name: Small Ship

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 2 crew)
25 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 35 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Small ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a small ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200lbs.

action: On its turn, the small ship can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than four crew. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than two crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

vehicle.name: Medium Ship

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 15 crew)
45 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 60 ft. while sailing with the wind.

weapon.name: Ballista
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage.

Ships typically include a ballista only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a ballista, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Dragonsmaw
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot long 5-foot wide line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that arent being worn or carried.

When a Dragonsmaw is destroyed, it explodes in a ball of fire. Each creature within 10ft of the weapon must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that arent being worn or carried.

Ships typically include a Dragonsmaw only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a dragonsmaw, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by two and the cargo capacity is reduced by 200 lbs.

weapon.name: Mangonels
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft. (can't hit targets within 60 ft. of it), one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d10}) bludgeoning damage.

Ships typically include a mangonels only when they are equipped for combat. If a ship is equipped with a mangonel, the maximum number of passengers the ship can carry is reduced by four and the cargo capacity is reduced by 400 lbs.

weapon.name: Naval Ram
entries: The ship has advantage on all saving throws relating to crashing when it crashes into a creature or an object. Any damage it takes from the crash is applied to the naval ram rather than to the ship. These benefits don't apply if another vessel crashes into the galley.

action: On its turn, the ship can take 3 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 2 actions if it has fewer than thirty crew and only 1 action if it has fewer than twenty. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than ten crew.

items.name: Fire Ballista.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object ballista||ballistas} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Fire Dragonsmaws.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its Dragonsmaws

items.name: Fire Mangonels.
items.entry: If it has at least one installed the ship can fire its {@object mangonel||mangonels} (DMG, ch. 8).

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this ammunition, unless it is magic ammunition that already has a bonus to those rolls.
Ammunition made of or coated with adamantine is unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever an adamantine ammunition hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.

The adamantine version of twenty pieces of ammunition costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the ammunition is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine ammunition can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you wear this armor, unless it is magic armor that already has a bonus to AC.
This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

The adamantine version of a set of armor costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the armor is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine armor can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to those rolls.
Melee weapons made of or coated with adamantine are unusually effective when used to break objects. Whenever an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is a critical hit.

The adamantine version of a melee weapon costs 750 gp more than the normal version and takes at least one workweek to make, whether the weapon is made of the metal or coated with it. Adamantine weapons can only be made at The Forge on Thalia.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn.
When you use this weapon to kill a humanoid creature you can expend one charge to cast {@spell animate dead|phb} on that creature.
Spiral grooves on the inside of the barrel force the bullet to spin when fired, helping it travel further. An engineer or blacksmith can rifle the inside of most barrels for 150gp.
The normal and long range of a rifled firearm are both doubled.
This has no effect on firearms with the Wide-Shot property.
Whenever you hit with a critical hit using this weapon, the bonus to this weapon's attack and damage rolls increases by 1 (to a maximum of +10).

entries.name: Curse
entries: This weapon is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell such as {@spell remove curse} or a similar effect. While cursed, whenever you hit with a critical hit using this weapon, your hit point maximum is reduced by {@dice 4d4}. If your hit point maximum is reduced to 0 or lower, you instantly die and your soul is consumed by the weapon, you can not be resurrected. If the curse is broken, the weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls is reduced to 0.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit a creature with this weapon, it whispers insults to them. If the hit is a critical hit, the insults are so damming that the creature takes an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.

This weapon has 3 charges, and it regains {@dice 1d3} expened charges daily at dawn. As a bonus action, you can expend a number of charges to cast {@spell elemental weapon|phb} on it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend. This casting of the spell does not require concentration and lasts for the full duration. The spell ends early if you cast it again using this weapon.
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.
When you hit a target with this ammunition, you forgo damage and the arrow transforms into a {@item net|phb}. The target is restrained as described in the net's description.
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

When you hit a target with this ammunition, you forgo damage and the target grows in size, as if targeted by the Enlarge effect of the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell. The spell does not require concentration for this casting and lasts for its full duration.
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

When you hit a target with this ammunition, you forgo damage and the target shrinks in size, as if targeted by the Reduce effect of the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell. The spell does not require concentration for this casting and lasts for its full duration.
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

When you hit a target with this ammunition, you forgo damage and the target is encased in a protective field, as if targeted by the {@spell shield of faith|phb} spell. The spell does not require concentration for this casting and lasts for its full duration.
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

When you hit a target with this ammunition, you forgo damage and the target is surrounded by a cloud of thick smoke, as if targeted by the {@spell fog cloud|phb} spell. The spell does not require concentration for this casting and lasts for its full duration.

This combination melee weapon and firearm is more common as a novelty collector's item, but can still be used as a viable weapon.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you make an attack with thise weapon, you can choose to make a normal melee attack or a ranged attack using the statistics of a {@item wheellock pistol|Caligos}.
This combination melee weapon and firearm is more common as a novelty collector's item, but can still be used as a viable weapon.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you make an attack with this weapon as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can choose to make a normal melee attack or a ranged attack using the statistics of a {@item wheellock musket|Caligos}.

variantrule.name: Hindering Traits
entries: Even the strongest heroes can have things that hold them back. These flaws have the opportunity make the character's story more interesting as they struggle to overcome challenges unique to them. The rules below are an optional way to encourage players to build flawed characters.
The Dungeon Master can decide to implement these rule in one of the following ways during character creation:

items: Each player is forced to take a number of Hindering traits at the begining of the game.
The players can freely choose or roll for a number of Hindering traits.
The DM can incentivize players to take Hindering traits by offering rewards for taking them. Examples of rewards could include ASI, Feats or Charms.

entries: The DM may also decide to assign certain traits to characters if they experience strong traumas that could lead to the trait developing.

entries.name: Hindering Trait Tables
entries: The DM may choose which of the below tables are available and their respective rewards, if any.

rows: {@b Weak.} Your Strength score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Clumsy.} Your Dexterity score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Glass Bones.} Your Constitution score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Absent Minded.} Your Intelligence score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Clueless.} Your Wisdom score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).
{@b Weak Willed.} Your Charisma score is permanently reduced by 3 (to a minimum of 3).

{@b Inept.} Randomly choose a skill, or have the DM choose. You cannot have a modifier higher than 0 for this skill, regardless of proficiency or expertise, and you gain disadvantage on any rolls made with this skill.
{@b Short Sighted.} You have disadvantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks and attack rolls against targets more than 30 feet away.
{@b Long Sighted.} You have disadvantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks and attack rolls against targets less than 10 feet away.

{@b Phobia.} You have an irrational fear of a particular thing, such as dogs, darkness or large bodies of water. When you are confronted by this thing, you must succeed on a DC12 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} by it until it is no longer visible.

{@b Infatuation.} You adore a particular type of creature or person, such as cute kittens or people with a specific hair colour. When you are confronted by a creature belonging to this group, you must make a DC12 Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, you become {@condition charmed} by the creature and wish to spend time with them, regardless of other any other pressing matters. This lasts for 1 hour or until you take damage.

{@b Vice.} You are addicted to a particular substance or activity, such as alcohol or gambling. Whenever you finish a long rest without having indulged in your vice since the last long rest, you must suceeded on a DC12 Charisma check or gain a level of exhaustion.
{@b Blind.} You permanently have the {@condition blinded} condition.
{@b Deaf.} You permanently have the {@condition deafened} condition.
{@b Mute.} You cannot speak.
{@b Illiterate.} You cannot read any languages without magic assistance, nor can you learn to.

{@b Missing or Paralyzed Leg.*} Your movement speeds (except flying), jumping distance and jumping height are all halved (rounded down). Additionally you have disadvantge on any checks or saving throws that require the use of your legs, such as climbing.*

{@b Missing or Paralyzed Arm.*} You only have one hand for items, weapons and spells. Additionally you have disadvantage on any checks or saving throws that require the use of arms or hands, such as climbing.*

entries: {@note *The DM may decide that your body also rejects any attempts to magically restore or replace the limb, including {@item prosthetic limb|tce|prosthetic limbs}.}

variantrule.name: Potions of Unknown Effect
entries: Alchemy is a complex science and few mortals can be expected to truly understand everything there is to know. Fortunately, knowing things is not always required to do things.

entries.name: Creating the Potion
entries: You can spend 1 hour using Alchemist's Supplies to attempt to create a potion. You must also provide some special component harvested from a creature of CR 1 or above, such as a giant scorpion stinger or a cyclops eye, creating the potion consumes this component. When you make the potion, make a Wisdom (Alchemist's Supplies) check and consult the table below to determine the result. Regardless of what you roll, you do not know the effect of the potion until it is consumed.

rows: Inert
You fail to make any drinkable liquid.
Lesser
The potion has one effect. Upon consumption, roll {@dice 2d100dh1|2d100}, take the lowest roll and consult the Potion Effects table below.
Basic
The potion has one effect. Upon consumption, roll {@dice 1d100} and consult the Potion Effects table below.
Greater
The potion has one effect. Upon consumption, {@dice 2d100dl1|2d100}, take the highest roll and consult the Potion Effects table below.
Superior
The potion has two effects. Upon consumption, roll {@dice 4d100dl2|4d100}, take the two highest rolls and consult the Potion Effects table below.
Coma
The drinker instantly drops to 0 hitpoints and falls {@condition unconscious}, they are automatically stabilised.
Greater Poison
The drinker takes {@dice 2d6+2} poison damage and gains the {@condition poisoned} condition for one minute.
Poison
The drinker takes {@dice 1d6+1} poison damage and gains the {@condition poisoned} condition for one minute.
Emetic
The drinker immediately vomits and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn.
Sedative
The drinker gains a level of exhaustion.
Narcotic
The drinker falls {@condition unconscious} and cannot be revived by non-magical means for {@dice 1d4} minutes.
Laxative
The drinker feels a sudden urge to empty their bowels and has disadvantage on ability checks until they do so.
Diuretic
The drinker feels a sudden urge to empty their bladder and has disadvantage on ability checks until they do so.
Lubricant

The drinker's feet are unable to gain any traction. If the creature is standing on their feet at the end of each of their turns, they must make a DC14 Dexterity save or become {@condition prone}. This lasts for 1 minute.
Frostbite

The drinker takes {@dice 1d6} cold damage and all their fingers fall off. They are unable to perform any action that would require the use of fingers, such as making a weapon attack. Their fingers regrow after {@dice 2d4} minutes.
Clearwood
All wooden items become invisible to the drinker for 1 hour. They have disadvantage when using items or weapons made mostly of wood or when attacking creatures made of, or wearing, mostly wood.
Clearmetal
All metal items become invisible to the drinker for 1 hour. They have disadvantage when using items or weapons made mostly of metal or when attacking creatures made of, or wearing, mostly metal.
Mute
The drinker cannot speak in any language for 1 hour.
Hallucinogenic
The drinker is {@condition blinded} by shapes and colours only they can see for 1d4 minutes.
Gigglewater
The drinker is hit by the effects of {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|phb}. They automatically fail the save.
Identity Crisis

The first person the drinker sees, the drinker believes they are that person for {@dice 2d4} minutes. They believe the original person is trying to impersonate them and cannot be convinced otherwise until the effect wears off.
Aphrodisiac
The drinker is {@condition charmed} by the first creature they see after drinking for {@dice 1d4} hours.
Colour Change
The drinker's skin changes a random colour that is unnatural for their race. This lasts until the end of the next long rest.
Elder Hair
The drinker's hair turns a shocking white. This lasts until the end of the next long rest.
Hair Growth
The hair on the drinker's head grows by {@dice 1d4} inches, even if they didn't have any to begin with.
The Answer

The drinker has an epiphany and they suddenly understands the meaning of life, the universe and everything. They, and anyone they tell, suddenly forget it after {@dice 1d6} seconds, any attempts to write it down or record it are also destroyed.
Body Growth
The drinker's height permanently increases by {@dice 2d4} inches.
Body Shrink
The drinker's height permanently decreases by {@dice 2d4} inches.
Gullible
The drinker believes anything they are told by anyone they consider friendly for one minute.
Songbird
The drinker can only communicate through rhyme and song for one hour. This applies even to writing.
Anti-Aging
The drinker becomes younger by {@dice 2d4} years.
Aging
The drinker becomes older by {@dice 2d4} years.
Honesty
The drinker cannot knowingly lie for one hour, as if under the effects of the {@spell zone of truth|phb} spell.
Daydream
The drinker believes they are currently in a dream and nothing they see or hear is actually real for one minute.
Plant Speak
The drinker can sense the innermost thoughts and emotions of every plant within a 120ft radius for 10 minutes. They do not necessarily understand them.
Boney
The drinker can see their own skeleton for 10 minutes.
Fudge

The drinker realises they are in a game but no one believes them. They can choose to reroll a single check or save they make within 1 hour. The new roll must be made before the outcome of the first roll is known. After the hour, the drinker forgets all about the outer world as does anyone they told.
Handy
The drinker grows an extra arm and hand for 10 minutes, they are able to use this arm as a bonus action to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only) or {@action Use an Object} action.
Polyglot
The drinker learns a new language chosen by the DM and can speak it fluently for {@dice 2d4} days, after which they completey forget it.
Pheremones
Any creature within 10ft of the drinker must make a Wisdom save against the drinker's Charisma or be {@condition charmed} by them for one hour.
Bestial
The drinker's nails grow long and sharp, their unarmed attacks become {@dice 1d10} + their Strength modifier slashing damage for one minute.
Polymorph
The drinker gains the effects of the {@spell Polymorph} spell for up to 1 hour, they are turned into a random beast of CR1 or lower. The DM decides the beast.
Dasher
The drinker's walking speed is increased by 15ft for one hour.
Thick Skin
The drinker gains +2 bonus to their AC for one minute.
Steroid
The drinker has advantage on all Strength checks and saves for one minute.
Stimulant
The drinker has advantage on all Dexterity checks and saves for one minute.
Booster
The drinker has advantage on all Constitution checks and saves for one minute.
Cognitive
The drinker has advantage on all Intelligence checks and saves for one minute.
Third Eye
The drinker has advantage on all Wisdom checks and saves for one minute.
Snake Oil
The drinker has advantage on all Charisma checks and saves for one minute.
Healing
The drinker restores {@dice 2d4+2} hitpoints.
Greater Healing
The drinker restores {@dice 4d4+4} hitpoints.
Energetic
The drinker instantly gains the benefits of a short rest.
Hyper-Energetic
The drinker instantly gains the benefits of a long rest.
Wild Magic
A Wild Magic Surge occurs, originating from the drinker.

variantrule.name: Pocket Sand
entries: Sometimes, you need to fight dirty. If your character has a free hand and quick access to a handful of sand or grit, such as with a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or being on sandy terrain, they can use it to gain a small advantage in combat.

As an action, the sand can be thrown at a creature within 5ft of you that has exposed eyes. The creature must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded|phb} until the start of its next turn.

variantrule.name: Creating Custom Dragons
entries: A number of dragon statblocks exist, but sometimes you may want a more unique dragon to your world or stories. These rules seek to provide an easy way to build custom dragons when the existing statblocks do not fit. Remember that these are guidelines only and you may adjust anything as you see fit.
First, choose the dragon's age and select the respective statblock from the list below:

items: {@creature Custom Dragon (Wyrmling)|JDragon}
{@creature Custom Dragon (Young)|JDragon}
{@creature Custom Dragon (Adult)|JDragon}
{@creature Custom Dragon (Ancient)|JDragon}
{@creature Custom Dragon (Greatwyrm)|JDragon}

entries: Within each statblock you will need to choose a damage type for its draconic essence trait. You will also choose a dragon form; Breathmaster, Mauler or Relentless, which determines certain traits in its stat block.

If you wish, you may then add a number of {@filter additional draconic traits|optionalfeatures|source=erlw;jackalope;caligos;phb;tce;xge;jdragon|feature type=draconic traits} to further distiguish the dragon.

entries.name: Example: Voltaic Dragon
entries: Voltan is a renowned enchanter and tinkerer who is a frequent target for thieves. He decides to build a dragon-like contraption to defend his vaults.
First, we decide the dragon's age. Since the party is 2nd-level and this is the first incarnation, we shall choose a {@creature Custom Dragon (Wyrmling)|JDragon|wyrmling}.
Second, we decide the damage type associated with its Draconic Essence trait. If we imagine the dragon being designed to electrocute intruders, we shall choose lightning damage.
Third, we decide the dragon's form. Since the dragon intends to slaughter intruders quickly, we shall choose Mauler.
Finally, we decide any addtional traits to add. Since the dragon was constructed and lacks emotion, we shall choose {@optfeature construct design|JDragon} and {@optfeature iron will|JDragon} traits.
Now we have a {@creature voltaic dragon (wyrmling)|JDragon} that should hopefully provide an interesting challenge for a low level party.

Over several decades, Voltan upgrades the dragon in various ways. Choosing different base statblocks and adding even more traits each time we end up with the statblocks for a {@creature voltaic dragon (young)|JDragon} and a {@creature voltaic dragon (adult)|JDragon}.

Voltan then decides to have the dragon upgrade itself, allowing it to outlive him. Over the next few centuries, the dragon begins hoarding magic items to enchance itself. Eventually, having exhausted the resources of its own world, the dragon heads out to the astral sea, harvesting the remains of dead gods. We can make the statblocks for the {@creature voltaic dragon (ancient)|JDragon} and the {@creature voltaic dragon (greatwyrm)|JDragon}
